Description: FOR THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE SAN FRANCISCO ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP'S ESTUARY BLUEPRINT.  INCLUDING FOUR GOALS THAT REPRESENT THE 35 YEAR VISION FOR THE FUTURE OF THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY-DELTA ESTUARY, 12 OBJECTIVES THAT DETAIL DESIRED OUTCOMES THAT MAKE PROGRESS TOWARDS ACHIEVING GOALS, AND 40 ACTIONS THAT LAY OUT A SET OF PRIORITY TASKS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED OVER THE NEXT 5 YEARS TO REACH ONE OR MORE OBJECTIVES. SPECIFIC PROJECTS INCLUDE A BOATER EDUCATION POLLUTION PREVENTION PROGRAM, PARTNERSHIPS WITH COASTAL CITIES PREPARING RESILIENCY PLANS,A FOCUS ON STORMWATER AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, THE 2017 STATE OF THE ESTUARY CONFERENCE, GEOGRAPHIC EFFORTS IN THE NAPA AND GUADALUPE WATERSHEDS TO ADDRESS EXISITING TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOADS (TMDLS) AND IN MARIN TO REDUCE RESIDENTS' PESTICIDE USE, AND OUTREACH EFFORTS TO EMPHASIZE THE IMPORTANCE OF FRESHWATER FLOWS FROM THE DELTA TO THE BAY.  THIS AGREEMENT PROIVIDES FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $600,000.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELAWARE CENTER FOR THE INLAND BAYS NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM'S COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) UNDER SECTION 320 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA), WHICH WILL HELP TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY AND ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE DELAWARE INLAND BAYS SYSTEM. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS PROJECT INCLUDE HABITAT RESTORATION, WATERSHED MONITORING, AND EDUCATION/OUTREACH EFFORTS. THE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES OF THE ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS PROJECT INCLUDE IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, IMPROVED COASTAL HABITAT CONDITIONS, AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MATTERS. 
THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF THE DELAWARE INLAND BAYS REGION.

DESCRIPTION:A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE CORPORATION FOR THE CONSERVATION OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY (CCSJBE) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF ITS COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY (SJBE). DURING FY 2023, THE ESTUARIO WILL IMPLEMENT THE 5-YEAR STRATEGIC PLAN ROADMAP FOR THE 2026 CCMP, WHICH WILL LAY OUT THE ACTIONS AND TIMELINES FOR THE REST OF THE REVISION PROCESS. TO ENSURE THE NEW CCMP TRULY REPRESENTS THE NEEDS AND INTERESTS OF THE PUBLIC, A MULTI-YEAR PUBLIC PARTICIPATION EFFORT WILL ACCOMPANY THE REVISION PROCESS. THE FINAL CCMP WILL TAKE INTO ACCOUNT THE RECOMMENDATIONS OF ESTUARIO'S MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE AND OTHER COMMITTEES AND TASK FORCES. THE ESTUARIO'S FIVE-YEAR STRATEGIC PLAN, WHICH GOES INTO EFFECT FY 2023, WILL ALSO IDENTIFY ADDITIONAL GOALS AND GUIDE PRIORITY ACTIONS AND ACTIVITIES TO ACHIEVE THE FOLLOWING GOALS:(1) ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE, (2) REDUCE NUTRIENT POLLUTION, (3) MARINE LITTER REDUCTION, AND (4) GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND RESILIENCY. ACTIVITIES:THIS UPCOMING FISCAL YEAR, THE SJBEP WILL CONTINUE MONITORING EFFORTS ON WATER BODIES THAT ARE MORE IMPACTED AND WILL BE DEVELOPING A PROPOSAL FOR THE INVESTIGATION OF THE SOURCES OF POLLUTION AND NUTRIENT DYNAMICS IN THE SAN JOSEACUTE; LAGOON, A BODY OF WATER THAT HAS HISTORICALLY SHOWN POOR WATER QUALITY CONDITIONS RELATED TO EXCESS NUTRIENT INPUTS AND LACK OF CIRCULATION. IN ADDITION, ESTUARIO AIMS TO EXPAND THE WATER COMMUNITY NETWORK AS THE FOUNDATION FOR AN AUTONOMOUS WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM THAT ALLOWS THE CITIZEN TO DIRECTLY PARTICIPATE IN THE RESTORATION OF THE ESTUARY'S WATERS. THE ESTUARIO'S SOLID WASTE PROGRAM AND OIL RECYCLING CAMPAIGN WILL BE EXPANDED INTO OTHER COMMUNITIES WITHIN THE WATERSHED. WILL DEVELOP A DEVELOP AN INTEGRATED MANAGEMENT WITHIN THE MUNICIPALITIES OF THE BASIN THAT WILL INCORPORATE A RECYCLING PLAN ADAPTED FOR THE NEW REALITIES TO REDUCE DEBRIS AND STIMULATE ECONOMIC ACTIVITY IN THE ESTUARIO COMMUNITIES. THE ESTUARIO WILL ALSO BE CONTINUING THE DEVELOPMENT OF THE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE MASTER PLAN FOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT, FOCUSING ON IDENTIFYING NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS TO SUPPORT INFRASTRUCTURE NEEDS AND VULNERABILITIES IDENTIFIED IN THE WATERSHED-BASED MULTIJURISDICTIONAL HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN. THE PLAN WILL PRIMARILY FOCUS ON STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS TO TACKLE THE RISKS FROM MASSIVE DEFOLIATION AFTER HURRICANES AND AN AGING GRAY INFRASTRUCTURE SYSTEM. THE SJBEP WILL CONDUCT AN ECONOMIC VALUATION STUDY THAT WILL CALCULATE THE ECONOMIC VALUE OF THE SAN JUAN BAY TO INFORM STORY BUILDING NARRATIVES AND FURTHER SUPPORT SJBE WATERSHED RESTORATION AND PROTECTION EFFORTS. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE TO EMPOWER COMMUNITIES WITH CAPACITY BUILDING AND TRAINING IN KEY AREAS THAT WILL INCREASE RESILIENCE AND PREPAREDNESS FOR NATURAL DISASTERS, AND IMPLEMENTATION OF COMMUNITY-BASED ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION AND MITIGATION EFFORTS. PROVIDE WORKFORCE DEVELOPMENT TO EDUCATORS AND ENVIRONMENTAL INTERPRETERS IN TOPICS RELATED TO THE ESTUARY AND OUR ECOSYSTEMS THAT WILL ALSO SERVE AS OPPORTUNITIES THAT WILL COUNT TOWARDS CREDITS FOR THE CITIZEN SCIENCE CERTIFICATION PROGRAM. INCREASE AWARENESS OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY SYSTEM AND ITS PARTICULAR INTEREST AREAS. INCREASE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT TO FAMILIARIZE THEMSELVES WITH ALTERNATIVES WITHIN THEIR COMMUNITIES. COMMUNICATE ESTUARIO'S EFFORTS ON A MONTHLY BASIS; SERVE AS SUBJECT EXPERT IN AREAS OF REVITALIZATION, RESTORATION, AND WATER CONSERVATION; PUBLICIZE THE EFFORTS AND ACTIVITIES PROPOSED IN THE MANAGEMENT PLAN. REDUCE THE AMOUNT OF THE SOLID WASTE AND INCREASE THE RECOLLECTION OF THE MATERIALS WITH POTENTIAL TO BE RECYCLED. PROVIDE SUPPORT AS NEEDED FOR THE DEVELOPMENT OF A GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE MASTE

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE BAY FOUNDATION OF MORRO BAY TO SUPPORT THE MORRO BAY NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (MB NEP) TO IMPLEMENT THEIR OWN MB NEP COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 320.  TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, THE MB NEP WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: DEVELOP AN EQUITY STRATEGY, TRACK THE HEALTH OF THE BAY AND WATERSHED HABITATS (INCLUDING BAY, CREEK, EEL GRASS AND FISH HABITATS), PLAN FOR HABITAT RESTORATION AND CLIMATE ADAPTATION, MANAGE INVASIVE SPECIES, IMPROVE OPEN SPACE ACCESS, IMPLEMENT WATERSHED BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, IMPROVE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE INCLUDING STORMWATER CONTROL, AND PROVIDE COMMUNICATION AND OUTREACH ABOUT THE BAY AND ITS WATERSHED INCLUDING THROUGH COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND STEWARDSHIP.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES $1,820,000 IN FEDERAL FUNDING.  PRE-AWARD COSTS ARE APPROVED BACK TO 11/01/2022.ACTIVITIES:TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, THE MB NEP WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:  DEVELOP AN EQUITY STRATEGY, MEASURE BAY AND WATERSHED CONDITIONS INCLUDING WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT QUALITY (INCLUDING EEL GRASS AND FISH HABITAT), MANAGE INVASIVE SPECIES, RESTORE HABITAT, PLAN CLIMATE ADAPTATION, IMPLEMENT WATERSHED BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, IMPROVE WATER INFRASTRUCTURE AND PROVIDE COMMUNICATION AND OUTREACH ABOUT THE BAY AND WATERSHED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN EQUITY STRATEGY, MONITORING, RESEARCH AND RESTORATION OF BAY AND WATERSHED HABITATS, IMPROVEMENT OF WATER INFRASTRUCTURE, INSTALLATION OF BEST MANAGEMENT PRACTICES ON THE WATERSHED, AS WELL AS OUTREACH AND COMMUNICATION TO THE MB NEP STUDY AREA RESIDENTS AND VISITORS.

DESCRIPTION:NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) BIL (BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FUNDING WILL SUPPORT THE ACCELERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND COMMUNITY RESTORATION GOALS WITHIN THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLANS (CCMPS) OF THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAMS. IN JULY 2022, THE SAN FRANCISCO ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (SFEP) UPDATED ITS COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP), THE 2022 SAN FRANCISCO ESTUARY BLUEPRINT.
THE 2022 ESTUARY BLUEPRINT RECOGNIZES THE IMPORTANCE OF MANAGING THE ESTUARY IN CONJUNCTION WITH HISTORICALLY MARGINALIZED AND VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES, AND IT IDENTIFIES REGIONAL ACTIONS TO ADDRESS HISTORIC IMPACTS OF INDUSTRIALIZATION AND POPULATION GROWTH, AS WELL AS TO MANAGE AND PLAN FOR A CHANGING CLIMATE THROUGH ADAPTATION. SFEP'S LONG-TERM PLAN FOR THE BIL FUNDING IS DESIGNED TO MEET THE OBJECTIVES OF THE BIL FUNDS TO: ACCELERATE AND MORE EXTENSIVELY IMPLEMENT CCMPS, ENSURE THAT BENEFITS REACH DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, BUILD THE ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES, AND LEVERAGE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES. THE TASKS MEET THE INTENT OF CWA SECTION 320 AND THE BIL GUIDANCE.ACTIVITIES:SPECIFIC TASKS INCLUDE SUPPORT FOR THE SAN LEANDRO BAY/OAKLAND-ALAMEDA ESTUARY ADAPTATION WORKING GROUP TO PRODUCE AN INCLUSIVE ACTION PLAN AND SUBREGIONAL ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE TO ACCELERATE SEA LEVEL RISE ADAPTATION AND ENHANCE CRITICAL INFRASTRUCTURE, NATURAL HABITAT, RECREATIONAL OPPORTUNITIES AND ACCESS, AND COMMUNITY RESILIENCE WITHIN THE SAN LEANDRO OPERATIONAL LANDSCAPE UNIT (OLU); ADVANCE CRITICAL RESEARCH AT THE ORO LOMA HORIZONTAL LEVEE WITH THE RECONSTRUCTION OF A PORTION OF THE EXISTING SITE TO TEST MORE EFFICIENT NUTRIENT REMOVAL DESIGNS AND TREATMENT; AND ESTABLISH AN INTERNAL EQUITY TEAM WITHIN SFEP.

THIS AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL BIL (BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $909,800.  SEE TERMS AND CONDITIONS.  PREAWARD COSTS HAVE BEEN APPROVED BACK TO JANUARY 1, 2023.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD TO ORO LOMA SANITARY DISTRICT: RECONFIGURE 2-3 CELLS OF THE ORO LOMA HORIZONTAL LEVEE FOR TREATING WASTEWATER
SUBAWARD TO CITY OF ALAMEDA: PROVIDE THE ADMINISTRATIVE SUPPORT AND STIPEND FUNDING FOR THE SAN LEANDRO ADAPTATION WORKING GROUP MEETINGS SO THAT LOCAL STAKEHOLDERS CAN MEANINGFULLY ENGAGE THROUGHOUT THE PROCESSOUTCOMES:COMMUNICATIONS OUTPUTS INCLUDING: REGULAR SOCIAL MEDIA POSTS; UPDATED WEBSITE PAGES; QUARTERLY ESTUARY BLUEPRINT NEWSLETTER, AND CONTINUED EXPANSION OF EXISTING AUDIENCES AND EXISTING COMMUNICATIONS CHANNELS AND MATERIALS. SFEP EQUITY TEAM; 2) EQUITY IMPLEMENTATION PLAN; 3) BIL PROGRAM EQUITY STRATEGY: 2-3 RECONFIGURED CELLS OF THE ORO LOMA HORIZONTAL LEVEE: 1) NEEDS ASSESSMENT AND ACTION PLAN FOR SAN LEANDRO OLU THAT INCLUDES A SHARED VISION, GROUP CHARTER, RECOMMENDED ORGANIZATIONAL STRUCTURE AND IDENTIFIED IMPLEMENTATION STEPS; 2) A TRANSFERRABLE MODEL FOR MULTI-JURISDICTIONAL, EQUITABLE, ADAPTATION PLANNING.

OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASED CAPACITY FOR VULNERABLE, UNDERSERVED, AND MARGINALIZED COMMUNITIES AND TRIBES TO ENGAGE IN REGIONAL PLANNING PROCESSES TO ADDRESS HISTORICAL INEQUITIES AND ANTICIPATED DISPROPORTIONATE IMPACTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON THESE COMMUNITIES; OPTIMIZE FUTURE DESIGNS FOR MULTI-BENEFIT HORIZONTAL LEVEES (REPLICABILITY, TREATMENT CAPACITY, AND COST-EFFECTIVENESS) FOR OTHER PROJECTS IN THE REGION AND BEYOND; INCREASED SUB-REGIONAL RESILIENCE TO SEA LEVEL RISE WITH THE IDENTIFICATION AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SHORELINE ADAPTATION STRATEGIES THAT PRIORITIZE EQUITY, BOTH WITHIN THE SAN LEANDRO OLU AND IN OTHER AREAS USING THIS PROJECT AS A MODEL.
THE BENEFICIARIES OF CCMP IMPLEMENTATION DESCRIBED ABOVE ARE THE MILLIONS OF RESIDENTS OF THE SAN FRANCISCO BAY AREA AND THE HABITATS AND SPECIES RELIANT ON THE HEALTH OF THE SAN FRANCISCO ESTUARY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO FUND THE SANTA MONICA BAY RESTORATION FOUNDATION TO SUPPORT THE SANTA MONICA BAY NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (SMBNEP) TO IMPLEMENT THEIR OWN COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) IN ACCORDANCE WITH CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 320. TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, THE SMBNEP WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: DEVELOP AN EQUITY STRATEGY, RESTORE KELP FORESTS, COVER ABALONE POPULATIONS, ASSESS AND IMPLEMENT OFFSHORE ARTIFICIAL REEFS, RESTORE HEALTHY BEACHES, RESTORE SMALL COASTAL LAGOONS, SUPPORT PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE COAST, AND MONITOR THE HEALTH OF ROCKY INTERTIDAL HABITATS.ACTIVITIES:TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, THE SMBNEP WILL ACCOMPLISH THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: DEVELOP AN EQUITY STRATEGY, CONTINUE RESTORATION OF KELP FOREST HABITAT AND POPULATIONS OF RED AND WHITE ABALONE; CREATE AN ADAPTABLE INTERTIDAL SYSTEM AND NEIGHBORING SUBTIDAL HABITAT ALONG THE SANTA MONICA BREAKWATER; RESTORE BEACH AND FOREDUNE HABITAT; CONSTRUCT A 'LIVING SHORELINE' ALONG MALIBU LAGOON STATE BEACH AND THE ADAMSON HOUSE;  DEVELOP A BEACH MANAGEMENT CERTIFICATION PROGRAM; PARTNER WITH THE BLACK SURFERS COLLECTIVE TO INCREASE BEACH ACCESS FOR UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES; AND CONDUCT A COASTAL ACCESS AND BEACH USER DATA STUDY.

THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FULL BIL (BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW) FEDERAL FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,820,000. DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT PROVIDES FUNDING TO MARYLAND COASTAL BAYS PROGRAM UNDER THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NEP COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND EPA STRATEGIC PLAN GOAL 5: ENSURE CLEAN AND SAFE WATER FOR ALL COMMUNITIES AND OBJECTIVE 5.2: - PROTECT AND RESTORE WATERBODIES AND WATERSHEDS TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES IN THE ESTUARY. SECTION 320 OF THE CWA AUTHORIZES THE ADMINISTRATOR OF THE EPA TO CONVENE MANAGEMENT CONFERENCES TO DEVELOP COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLANS FOR ESTUARIES OF NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE THAT ARE THREATENED BY POLLUTION, DEVELOPMENT, OR OVERUSE. ACTIVITIES:THE PROJECTS INCLUDED WILL SUPPORT ACTIVITIES THAT ADDRESS THE KEY CHALLENGES FACING THE ESTUARY INCLUDING ASSESSING TRENDS IN WATER QUALITY, HABITATS, NATURAL RESOURCES AND USES; COORDINATING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CCMP BY THE NEP, ALONG WITH THE STATE, FEDERAL, LOCAL AGENCIES, STAKEHOLDERS, NGOS, CITIZENS, PARTNERS, AND OTHERS; AND MONITORING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED UNDER THE MANAGEMENT CONFERENCE APPROVED CCMP AND ANNUAL WORKPLAN. SOME SPECIFIC WORK AND ACTIONS TO BE ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THIS AWARD INCLUDE CONTINUATION OF ONGOING PROJECTS TO RESTORE IMPORTANT COASTAL AND INLAND HABITATS AND SPECIES OF SIGNIFICANCE; DEVELOPMENT OF A NEW CCMP; PLANNING AND EXECUTION OF A PROGRAMMATIC EVALUATION; CONDUCTING PUBLIC ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION PROGRAMMING, COMMUNITY OUTREACH CAMPAIGNS; MONITORING STREAMS AND COASTAL BAYS FOR CONTINUOUS EFFORTS; AND DEVELOPING TECHNICAL AND PUBLIC REPORTS.SUBRECIPIENT:SUPPORTING THE WORK OF THE CHESAPEAKE CONSERVATION CORPS IN IMPLEMENTING THE MCBP CCMP; SUPPORTING THE WORK OF UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND CENTER FOR ENVIRONMENTAL STUDIES IN THEIR DEVELOPMENT OF ANNUAL REPORT CARD AND ECO-HEALTH REPORTING RESOURCES AND ACCESS. OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE MCBP ANNUAL REPORT CARD ON WATERSHED QUALITY AND HEALTH AND THE CONTINUED SUPPORT OF UNIVERSITY OF MARYLAND - EASTERN SHORE (UMES) THROUGH THE LEAP MOU PROGRAM. MCBP ANTICIPATES HOSTING FOUR PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT WORKSHOPS AND 12 COMMUNITY VOLUNTEER AND PUBLIC EDUCATION EVENTS. THEY ALSO ANTICIPATE APPLICATIONS FOR DESIGN/IMPLEMENTATION FUNDING FOR PRIORITIZED PROJECTS AND PROFESSIONAL DEVELOPMENT OF MCBP STAFF AS A DELIVERABLE. OUTCOMES FROM THIS AWARD INCLUDE IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND GROWTH IN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP IN THE WATERSHED, INCREASED COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP AND BEHAVIOR CHANGE AROUND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND THE PRESERVATION/ENHANCEMENT OF WATER QUALITY, CRITICAL HABITAT AND COASTAL RESILIENCE RESOURCES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED, VISITORS TO THE EASTERN SHORE AND COASTAL BAYS, INDUSTRIES AND BUSINESSES THAT RELY ON THE COASTAL BAYS, STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE LOCAL SCHOOL SYSTEM AND OF UMES, AND THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MARYLAND COASTAL BAY PROGRAM'S COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) UNDER SECTION 320 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA), WHICH WILL HELP TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY AND ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE MARYLAND COASTAL BAYS SYSTEM. ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS PROJECT INCLUDE HABITAT RESTORATION, WATERSHED MONITORING, AND EDUCATION/OUTREACH EFFORTS. THE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES OF THE ACTIVITIES UNDER THIS PROJECT INCLUDE IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, IMPROVED COASTAL HABITAT CONDITIONS, AND INCREASED COMMUNITY AWARENESS AND KNOWLEDGE ON ENVIRONMENTAL MATTERS. 

THE BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROJECT INCLUDE THE RESIDENTS AND VISITORS OF THE MARYLAND COASTAL BAYS REGION.

DESCRIPTION:A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO OCEAN COUNTY COLLEGE (OCC) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE 2021 COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) PREPARED BY THE BARNEGAT BAY PARTNERSHIP (BBP) AND THE POLICY COMMITTEE-APPROVED ANNUAL WORKPLAN. THE BARNEGAT BAY PARTNERSHIP IS ONE OF 28 NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAMS NATIONWIDE, AND CONDUCTS ITS WORK BY IMPLEMENTING THE EPA-APPROVED CCMP.  THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, RESTORE AND PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE BARNEGAT BAY ESTUARY.  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CCMP WILL SEEK TO PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY THROUGHOUT BARNEGAT BAY AND ITS WATERSHED; ENSURE ADEQUATE WATER SUPPLIES AND FLOW FOR ECOLOGICAL AND HUMAN COMMUNITIES; PROTECT AND RESTORE HABITAT AND HEALTHY AND SUSTAINABLE NATURAL COMMUNITIES OF PLANTS AND ANIMALS AND; IMPROVE AND SUSTAIN COLLABORATIVE APPROACHES TO RESPONSIBLE LAND USE PLANNING AND OPEN SPACE PRESERVATION.  THE BBP WILL MAKE AVAILABLE SUB-AWARDS FOR RESEARCH AND IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS THAT EITHER FURTHER PROGRESS TOWARDS THE WATER QUALITY, WATER SUPPLY, LIVING RESOURCES AND LAND USE PLANNING GOALS DESCRIBED ABOVE AND/OR PROJECTS THAT PROVIDE INFORMATION NEEDED TO ASSESS THE CURRENT STATUS OF EIGHT ECOSYSTEM-BASED TARGETSACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT AND IMPROVE WATER QUALITY INCLUDE WATER QUALITY MONITORING, TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE FOR NUTRIENT REDUCTION, DEVELOPMENT OF WATERSHED PROTECTION PLANS FOR SUB-WATERSHEDS, AND SUPPORT FOR REDUCING SOURCES OF MARINE DEBRIS.  ACTIVITIES TO ENSURE ADEQUATE WATER SUPPLIES AND FLOW FOR ECOLOGICAL AND HUMAN COMMUNITIES INCLUDE WORKING WITH PARTNERS ON WATER SUPPLY CONSERVATION MEASURES AND ASSOCIATED PUBLIC OUTREACH.  ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT, RESTORE AND ENHANCE LIVING RESOURCES INCLUDE REDUCING BOATING IMPACTS, EELGRASS RESTORATION, COASTAL WETLAND MONITORING, AND INCREASING COASTAL RESILIENCY TO CLIMATE CHANGE.  ACTIVITIES TO IMPROVE AND SUSTAIN RESPONSIBLE LAND USE PLANNING AND OPEN SPACE PRESERVATION INCLUDES LAND ACQUISITION AND PROMOTING STEWARDSHIP AND RESPONSIBLE USE OF OPEN SPACE.  SUBRECIPIENT:THE BBP SCIENCE AND TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE WILL ISSUE A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS FOR IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS TO FURTHER CCMP GOALS.  OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES RELATING TO PROTECTING AND RESTORING WATER QUALITY INCLUDE COLLECTION OF WATER QUALITY DATA THAT WILL BE USED TO INFORM MANAGEMENT DECISIONS; ENHANCEMENT TO THE JERSEY-FRIENDLY YARDS WEBSITE TO CONTINUE REDUCTIONS OF NUTRIENTS INTO THE WATERSHED; DEVELOPMENT AND IMPLEMENTATION OF SUB-WATERSHED PLANS PROTECTION AND RESTORATION PLANS; AND ANNUAL BEACH CLEANUPS.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES RELATED TO ENSURING ADEQUATE WATER SUPPLY AND FLOWS INCLUDE IDENTIFICATION OF PROJECTS TO REDUCE CONSUMPTIVE WATER USE AND PROTECT SUPPLIES AND USE OF SOCIAL MEDIA TO PROMOTE WATER CONSERVATION.   ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR RESTORING AND PROTECTING LIVING RESOURCES INCLUDE DEVELOPMENT OF OUTREACH MATERIALS FOR BOATERS TO PROTECT SEAGRASS; A FINAL REPORT FOR THE BIENNIAL DEMOGRAPHIC SURVEY OF SEAGRASS BEDS AND DEVELOPMENT OF A BEST PRACTICES DOCUMENT FOR SEAGRASS RESTORATION; COLLECTION OF DATA THROUGH COMMUNITY SCIENCE PROGRAMS AND; CONTINUED MONITORING OF COASTAL WETLANDS.   ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES FOR LAND USE PLANNING INCLUDE THE ACQUISITION OF 750 ACRES OF OPEN SPACE AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF PUBLIC OUTREACH TOOLS TO EXPLAIN THE ECOLOGICAL BENEFIT OF LAND ACQUISITION TO THE PUBLIC.  OTHER PROGRAM DELIVERABLES INCLUDE THE DEVELOPMENT OF COMMUNICATION, MONITORING, HABITAT AND FINANCIAL PLANS TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CCMP.  

THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES OF THIS AWARD ARE THE CONTINUATION OF RESTORATION AND PROTECTION OF WATER QUALITY, WATER SUPPLIES, LIVING RESOURCES, AND LAND USE IN THE BARNEGAT BAY AND ITS WATERSHED AND EDUCATION AND OUTREACH TO ENHANCE STEWARDSHIP IN THE ESTUARY. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE GENERAL POPULATION THROUGHOUT

DESCRIPTION:A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO HUDSON RIVER FOUNDATION FOR SCIENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH, INC.  TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NY/NJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY' PROGRAM'S COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING ACTION PLAN PREPARED BY HUDSON RIVER FOUNDATION AND STAKEHOLDERS TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE NEW YORK-NEW JERSEY HARBOR AND ESTUARY. THIS AGREEMENT ALSO SUPPORTS THE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP WHICH AIMS TO STIMULATE REGIONAL AND LOCAL ECONOMIES, CREATE LOCAL JOBS, IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE, AND PROTECT AMERICANS' HEALTH BY REVITALIZING URBAN WATERWAYS IN UNDER-SERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE SPECIFIED WITHIN THE NY-NJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY PROGRAM'S FY 2023 ANNUAL BUDGET AND WORKPLAN ATTACHED TO THIS FUNDING RECOMMENDATION, AND SUPPORT THE NYNJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY PROGRAMS 2017 - 2025 ACTION AGENDA. ACTIONS INCLUDE SUPPORTING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, REDUCE SOURCES OF TRASH AND FLOATABLES TO THE HARBOR, RESTORE AND CONSERVE WETLANDS AND OTHER HABITATS, INCORPORATE SEA LEVEL RISE INTO RESTORATION AND HABITAT MANAGEMENT PRACTICES, INCREASE TRIBUTARY CONNECTIONS TO THE HARBOR, ADVANCE OPPORTUNITIES TO INCREASE PUBLIC ACCESS (PARTICULARLY IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES), WORK CLOSELY WITH THE URBAN WATER PARTNERSHIP AMBASSADORS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND PROVIDE AN IMPORTANT PLATFORM FOR COMMUNICATION BETWEEN FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATION PARTNERS TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH OF THE ESTUARY.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD - WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR PASSAIC URBAN  WATERS AMBASSADOR  URBAN WATERS WORKPLAN AND PROJECTS 
SUBAWARD - WILL SUPPORT PARTNER ENGAGEMENT IN HEP MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE AGENDAS AND MINUTES 
SUBAWARD - WILL SUPPORT FOR OUTREACH AND SHORELINE CLEAN UPS: WQ#8208;B#8208; 5  FINAL REPORT 
SUBAWARD - WILL SUPPORT COMMUNITY BASED MONITORING EFFORTS FOR AMERICAN EELS: H#8208;C#8208;1: HABITAT MONITORING. FINAL REPORTS 
SUBAWARD (MATCH) HUDSON RIVER FOUNDATION  RESEARCH SUPPORT WILL PROVIDE SUPPORT FOR RESEARCH ON THE HUDSON RIVER AND ESTUARY WITH FINAL REPORTS 
 SUBAWARD (MATCH)   HUDSON RIVER BIOLOGICAL  MONITORING PROGRAM RESEARCH SUPPORT FOR THE CONTAMINANT AND REDUCTION PROGRAM WITH  FINAL REPORTS  

OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES AND EXPECTED OUTCOMES AND INTENDED BENEFICIARIES INCLUDED IN THE FY 2023 WORKPLAN INCLUDE: 
1) QUARTERLY WATER QUALITY WORKGROUP MEETINGS AND CONTINUOUS MONITORING PRACTITIONERS SUBCOMMITTEE, INCLUDING MINUTES. GOVERNMENT, SCIENTIST AND PUBLIC STAKEHOLDERS.
2) PREPARE SHARED WATERS WATER QUALITY COMMUNICATIONS BROCHURE. FEDERAL, STATE AND PUBLIC STAKEHOLDERS.
3) CONTINUE TO MAINTAIN NON-GOVERNMENTAL WATER QUALITY MONITORING DATABASE.  ALL STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ESTUARY.
4) PLAN AND HOLD ANNUAL CONFERENCE AND VARIOUS WORKSHOPS ON THE STATE OF THE NYNJ HARBOR ESTUARY. ALL STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ESTUARY.
5) THE RESTORATION WORKGROUP WILL CONTINUE TO WORK WITH THE US ARMY CORPS OF ENGINEERS, STATES AND LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO IDENTIFY  APPROPRIATE ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION PROJECTS, WITH PRIORITY SITES IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES. ALL STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ESTUARY.
6) SUPPORT THE PASSAIC RIVER AND BRONX /HARLEM URBAN WATER AMBASSADORS FOR SCIENCE AND OUTREACH PROGRAMS. DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES ON THE PASSAIC AND BRONX AND HARLEM RIVERS.
7) ANNUALLY PREPARE DATA FOR EPA REGARDING ALL STAKEHOLDER RESTORATION AND HABITAT CREATION IN THE NYNJ HARBOR ESTUARY PROGRAM'S GEOGRAPHIC AREA FOR EPA NEPORT.  EPA HQ AND ALL STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ESTUARY.
8) WORK WITH COMMUNITIES TO IDENTIFY EXISTING AND PROPOSED PUBLIC ACCESS SITES, AND UPDATE EXISTING 'PADDLERS GUIDE TO THE ESTUARY'. COMMUNITY USERS OF THE ESTUARY.
9) PREPARE ANNUAL REPORT OF ACTIONS. EPA AND STAKEHOLDERS IN THE ESTUARY.

A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE RESEARCH FOUNDATION SUNY TO SUPPORT THE PECONIC ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP'S WORK RESTORING AND PROTECTING WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT IN EASTERN LONG ISLAND. THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT THE STAFF OF THE PECONIC ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP AS THEY CARRY OUT A RANGE OF ENVIRONMENTAL PROJECTS INCLUDED IN THE CCMP, AND SUPPORTS NEW YORK STATE DEPARTMENT OF ENVIRONMENTAL CONSERVATION AND SUFFOLK COUNTY'S IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS THAT SUPPORT THE PECONIC ESTUARY'S RESTORATION AND PROTECTION. THE GOAL OF THIS PROGRAM IS TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE PECONIC ESTUARY.

DESCRIPTION:THE PEP 2020 COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) GUIDES THE PRIORITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND, AS SUCH, ALL PROJECTS AND PLANS DETAILED IN THIS WORKPLAN RELATE DIRECTLY TO THE ACTIONS ESTABLISHED TO ACHIEVE OUR FOUR GOALS: STRONG PARTNERSHIPS AND ENGAGEMENT, CLEAN WATERS, RESILIENT COMMUNITIES PREPARED FOR CLIMATE CHANGE, AND A HEALTHY ECOSYSTEM WITH ABUNDANT, DIVERSE WILDLIFE. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA OR 'BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW' OR BIL) PASSED THE U.S. SENATE IN AUGUST 2021 AND THE U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES IN NOVEMBER 2021. PRESIDENT BIDEN SIGNED IT INTO LAW ON NOVEMBER 15, 2021. THIS LEGISLATION PROVIDES AN ADDITIONAL $132 MILLION TO THE 28 NEPS OVER FIVE YEARS IN ADDITION TO REGULAR APPROPRIATIONS. FOR THE PEP THIS RESULTS IN AN ADDITIONAL $909,800 ANNUALLY FROM FY22 TO FY26 TO CARRY OUT WORK THAT ACCELERATES AND MORE EXTENSIVELY IMPLEMENTS THE 2020 CCMP, ENSURES BENEFITS REACH DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND BUILDS THE ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES.
THREE PROJECTS WILL BE EXECUTED UNDER THE FY22 BIL FUNDING. THESE PROJECTS ARE:
1. MEETINGHOUSE CREEK WETLAND RESTORATION - CONSTRUCTION PHASE OF A GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE FOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PROJECT. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A 1.2-ACRE STORMWATER WETLAND TO TREAT STORMWATER RUNOFF AND CREATE ADDITIONAL CAPACITY TO MANAGE INCREASED FLOODING. 
2. SAG HARBOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT -  INSTALLATION OF TWO GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, WHICH ARE OUTLINED IN THE VILLAGE OF SAG HARBOR'S WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECT PLAN. THE TWO INSTALLATIONS WILL INCLUDE RAIN GARDENS AND ROAD AMENDMENTS FOR INCREASED STORMWATER CAPACITY AND ROAD RE-GRADING AND AMENDMENTS WITH THE USE OF IMPERVIOUS PAVEMENT.
3. GOOSE CREEK SUB-CATCHMENT DISCHARGE ELIMINATION - COMPLETION OF THE DISCHARGE REMOVAL IN THE SUB-CATCHMENT OF GOOSE CREEK, SOUTHOLD, NY. THREE MAJOR OUTFALLS WILL REQUIRE EXTENSIVE DRAINAGE TO BE INSTALLED AT THE CURRENT OUTFALL LOCATION AND UPSTREAM OF THE OUTFALL TO ENSURE THAT LOCALIZED FLOODING OF THE ROAD DOES NOT OCCUR.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES UNDER EACH PROJECT ARE:
1. MEETINGHOUSE CREEK WETLAND RESTORATION - ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE CONSTRUCTION PHASE OF A GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE FOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION PROJECT. THIS PROJECT WILL CONSTRUCT A 1.2-ACRE STORMWATER WETLAND TO TREAT STORMWATER RUNOFF AND CREATE ADDITIONAL CAPACITY TO MANAGE INCREASED FLOODING. THE RESTORATION OF THIS STORMWATER WETLAND HAS FOUR OBJECTIVES: 1) TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN THE MEETINGHOUSE CREEK SUB-CATCHMENT; 2) TO PROVIDE INCREASED COASTAL RESILIENCY BY INCREASING STORM WATER CAPACITY IN THIS SUB-CATCHMENT USING RESTORED WETLAND FUNCTION AND INCREASING CAPACITY TO A 100-YEAR STORMWATER FLOOD LEVEL; 3) CREATE INCREASED COASTAL RESILIENCY IN A NEW YORK STATE DESIGNATED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREA; AND 4) PROVIDE INCREASED EDUCATION ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE AND COASTAL ADAPTATION USING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE TO THE COMMUNITY. ADDITIONALLY, WETLAND RESTORATION INCREASES THE ECOLOGICAL QUALITY OF THE HABITAT AND IMPROVES PLANT AND WILDLIFE DIVERSITY.

2. SAG HARBOR STORMWATER MANAGEMENT - ACTIVITIES INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF TWO GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS, WHICH ARE OUTLINED IN THE VILLAGE OF SAG HARBOR'S WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECT PLAN. THE TWO INSTALLATIONS WILL INCLUDE RAIN GARDENS AND ROAD AMENDMENTS FOR INCREASED STORMWATER CAPACITY AND ROAD RE-GRADING AND AMENDMENTS WITH THE USE OF IMPERVIOUS PAVEMENT. THE INSTALLATION OF TWO GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AREAS HAVE THREE OBJECTIVES TO: 1) IMPROVE WATER QUALITY IN SAG HARBOR COVE AND SAG HARBOR BAY; 2) CREATE INCREASED COASTAL RESILIENCY IN A NYS DESIGNATED ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREA THAT IS PRONE TO FLOODING AND PROJECTED TO EXPERIENCE INCREASED PRECIPITATION; AND 3) PROVIDE INCREASED EDUCATION ABOUT CLIMATE CHANGE, COASTAL ADAPTATION AND STORMWATER MANAGEMENT USING GREEN IN

DESCRIPTION:THE PEP 2020 COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) GUIDES THE PRIORITIES OF THE ORGANIZATION AND, AS SUCH, ALL PROJECTS AND PLANS DETAILED IN THIS WORKPLAN RELATE DIRECTLY TO THE ACTIONS ESTABLISHED TO ACHIEVE OUR FOUR GOALS: STRONG PARTNERSHIPS AND ENGAGEMENT, CLEAN WATERS, RESILIENT COMMUNITIES PREPARED FOR CLIMATE CHANGE, AND A HEALTHY ECOSYSTEM WITH ABUNDANT, DIVERSE WILDLIFE. THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA OR 'BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW' OR BIL) PASSED THE U.S. SENATE IN AUGUST 2021 AND THE U.S. HOUSE OF REPRESENTATIVES IN NOVEMBER 2021. PRESIDENT BIDEN SIGNED IT INTO LAW ON NOVEMBER 15, 2021. THIS LEGISLATION PROVIDES AN ADDITIONAL $132 MILLION TO THE 28 NEPS OVER FIVE YEARS IN ADDITION TO REGULAR APPROPRIATIONS. FOR THE PEP THIS RESULTS IN AN ADDITIONAL $909,800 ANNUALLY FROM FY22 TO FY26 TO CARRY OUT WORK THAT ACCELERATES AND MORE EXTENSIVELY IMPLEMENTS THE 2020 CCMP, ENSURES BENEFITS REACH DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND BUILDS THE ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES. THIS AWARD WILL BE EXECUTED UNDER THE FY23 BIL FUNDING AND PROVIDE $50,000 TO SUFFOLK COUNTY TO SUPPORT SUFFOLK COUNTY'S EXISTING RECLAIM OUR WATERS INITIATIVE AND PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CONTINUED MAINTENANCE OF INNOVATIVE/ALTERNATIVE SEPTIC SYSTEMS FOR AN ADDITIONAL 2-3 YEARS FOR HOUSEHOLDS THAT QUALIFY AS LOW/MEDIAN AND MEDIAN HOUSEHOLDS UNDER THE EXISTING SUFFOLK COUNTY PROGRAM. THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REDUCE NITROGEN POLLUTION IN THE WATERSHED AND PROVIDE ADDITIONAL AND EQUITABLE SUPPORT TO LOW INCOME HOUSEHOLDS TO ENABLE THEM TO ACHIEVE INCREASED WATER QUALITY.
ACTIVITIES:SUFFOLK COUNTY HAS BEEN ADMINISTERING THE RECLAIM OUR WATERS INITIATIVE SINCE 2017, WHICH PROVIDES GRANTS TO HOMEOWNERS TO UPGRADE THEIR EXISTING CESSPOOLS AND SEPTIC SYSTEMS WITH NEW ALTERNATIVE LOW NITROGEN SYSTEMS. NITROGEN POLLUTION IN THE GROUNDS AND SURFACE WATERS OF THE PECONIC WATERSHED HAS BEEN IDENTIFIED AS A LEADING CAUSE OF POLLUTION AND HABS. THE EXISTING SUFFOLK COUNTY PROGRAM ALLOWS FOR ADDITIONAL GRANT FUNDING FOR HOUSEHOLDS THAT QUALIFY AS LOW/MEDIAN AND MEDIAN INCOME HOUSEHOLDS UNDER THE HOUSING AND URBAN DEVELOPMENT CRITERIA. SUFFOLK COUNTY MAKES THIS DETERMINATION AND HAS ADMINISTERED THIS PROGRAM AND IDENTIFIED THESE HOUSEHOLDS. THE EXISTING PROGRAM ALLOWS FOR THREE YEARS OF MAINTENANCE TO NEW INNOVATIVE SEPTIC SYSTEMS. IN THE CURRENT THREE YEAR, GRANT FUNDED MAINTENANCE COMES TO A CLOSE. THROUGH THIS AWARD, PEP WILL FUND AN ADDITIONAL 2- 3 YEARS OF MAINTENANCE OF THESE SYSTEMS FOR THE HOUSEHOLDS THAT QUALIFY AS LOW/MEDIAN AND MEDIAN HOUSEHOLDS UNDER THE EXISTING PROGRAM AND CONTINUE TO SUPPORT COMMUNITIES IN NEED BY PROVIDING CONTINUED, EQUITABLE ACCESS TO NITROGEN REDUCING SEPTIC SYSTEMS IN OUR ESTUARY WATERSHED.

SUBRECIPIENT:THERE IS ONE SUBAWARD INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT. THIS SUBAWARD WILL PROVIDE $50,000 TO SUPPORT SUFFOLK COUNTY'S EXISTING RECLAIM OUR WATERS INITIATIVE AND PROVIDE FUNDING FOR THE CONTINUED MAINTENANCE OF INNOVATIVE/ALTERNATIVE SEPTIC SYSTEMS FOR AN ADDITIONAL 2-3 YEARS FOR HOUSEHOLDS THAT QUALIFY AS LOW/MEDIAN AND MEDIAN HOUSEHOLDS UNDER THE EXISTING SUFFOLK COUNTY PROGRAM. OUTCOMES:THE ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE AN ANNUAL REPORTING OF THE NUMBER OF HOUSEHOLDS AND MAPS OF AREAS THAT HAVE BEEN SERVICED UNDER THESE FY23 BIL FUNDS AND THE EXPECTED OUTCOME IS INCREASED REDUCTION OF NITROGEN IN LOW/MEDIAN INCOME AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREAS WITHIN THE PECONIC ESTUARY WATERSHED. THE DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM ALSO INCLUDE THE GENERAL POPULATION THROUGHOUT THE PECONIC WATERSHED AND ITS SURROUNDING AREAS, SCHOOLS, UNIVERSITIES AND OTHER INSTITUTIONS OF LEARNING, ENVIRONMENTAL MANAGERS AND POLICY MAKERS AND THE PARTICIPANTS IN THE PECONIC ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP.

DESCRIPTION:A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE CORPORATION FOR THE CONSERVATION OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY (CCSJBE) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF ITS COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY (SJBE). THE SAN JUAN BAY ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (SJBEP), OR THE ESTUARIO, WILL USE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) FUNDING TO RESTORE THE JUAN MEACUTE;NDEZ CREEK, IN THE MUNICIPALITY OF SAN JUAN THROUGH HIGH-IMPACT BLUE/GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE INTERVENTIONS, ACHIEVING MEDIUM TERM RESTORATION OF WATERS COMMUNITIES AFFECTED BY THIS BODY OF WATER, MANY OF WHICH ARE ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES. THIS GOAL IS CONSISTENT WITH THE SJBEP'S COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP), GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE ACTION PLAN, ACTION 2: CREATE A PILOT PROJECT FOR REVERSING THE CHANNELIZATION BY CONCRETE OF A SEGMENT OF A RIVER, CREEK, OR FRESHWATER TRIBUTARY WITHIN THE SJBE. DURING THE 1ST YEAR OF BIL FUNDING WILL BE USED PRIMARILY ON CONVENING RELEVANT STAKEHOLDERS TO PLAN AND CARRY OUT THE ANALYSIS NECESSARY TO DEVELOP A RESTORATION PLAN FOR THE JUAN MEACUTE;NDEZ CREEK, WHICH WILL BE ACHIEVED THROUGH THE CREATION OF AN INFRASTRUCTURE COMMITTEE MADE UP OF SUBJECT MATTER EXPERTS AND KEY DECISION-MAKERS.ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES AND TASKS IN THIS WORKPLAN IMPLEMENT NEP BIL FUNDING PRIORITIES SUCH AS: (1) ACCELERATE AND MORE EXTENSIVELY IMPLEMENT CCMP- THE RESTORATION OF THE JUAN MEACUTE;NDEZ CREEK WAS SELECTED BASED ON THE URGENCY AND DEGREE TO WHICH VULNERABLE COMMUNITIES ARE BEING AFFECTED BY SANITARY DISCHARGES, WHICH HAS BEEN A LONG-STANDING PROBLEM. IN ADDITION, THE ACTIVITIES WERE CHOSEN TO MAXIMIZE THE IMPACT OF PROJECTS IN OTHER PROGRAM AREAS FUNDED BY OTHER SOURCES WHICH SUPPORT CCMP IMPLEMENTATIONS SUCH AS THE MULTIJURISDICTIONAL HAZARD MITIGATION PLAN, GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE MASTER PLAN, AND ILLICIT DISCHARGE DETECTION AND ELIMINATION PROJECT, AND COLLABORATIVE WATER QUALITY MONITORING EFFORTS. (2) ENSURE BENEFITS REACH DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES- IN COMPLIANCE WITH BIL GUIDELINES, THE ESTUARIO WILL DEVELOP AN EQUITY STRATEGY BY JUNE 2023. THIS STRATEGY WILL DEVELOP A BASELINE TO UNDERSTAND HOW THE PROJECTS BENEFITS DISADVANTAGE COMMUNITIES AND ALLOWS THE PROGRAM TO QUANTITATIVELY TRACK ITS PROGRESS. (3) BUILD ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES-THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS WORK PLAN PRIORITIZE THESE ASPECTS IN THE FOLLOWING WAYS: IMPLEMENTING A ROBUST COLLABORATIVE WATER QUALITY MONITORING PROGRAM THAT WILL MEASURE CHANGES OCCURRING IN THE ESTUARY'S BODIES OF WATER; UNDERSTANDING THE IMPACT OF DROUGHTS AND FLOODS ON THE LANDSCAPE, HABITAT, AND WATER SUPPLY; AND BUILD AWARENESS ON HOW GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS HELP COMBAT CLIMATE CHANGE. (4) LEVERAGE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES-  THE ACTIVITIES IN THIS WORK PLAN WERE SELECTED TO COMPLEMENT PARTNER EFFORTS AND FURTHER CURRENT PROJECTS THAT OTHERWISE WOULD NOT HAVE THE RESOURCES TO BE IMPLEMENTED. THE PROGRAM WILL IDENTIFY AND APPLY TO FUNDING SOURCES FOR INVESTMENTS IN COLLABORATION WITH PARTNERS IN TECHNOLOGY FOR A COLLABORATIVE DATA DASHBOARD IF NEEDED.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:EXPECTED OUTCOMES ARE AS FOLLOWS: (1) TO ADOPT AN ADAPTIVE MANAGEMENT APPROACH TO IDENTIFY ACTIONS AND PRIORITIES AND UNDERSTAND THE IMPACT OF RESTORATION/INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS ON WATER QUALITY. (2) IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, AND STORMWATER MANAGEMENT, INCREASED COASTAL RESILIENCE, AND STRENGTHEN THE COAST THROUGH NUTRIENT REDUCTION STRATEGIES OF BODIES OF WATER IN THE WATERSHED, COMMUNITY MADE UP OF EXPERTS AND KNOWLEDGE HOLDERS. (3) CONDUCT A RECONNAISSANCE STUDY OF THE JUAN MEACUTE;NDEZ CREEK TO ASSESS CURRENT CONDITIONS THAT IS INFORMED BY THE ILLICIT DISCHARGE DETECTION AND ELIMINATION PROJECT. (4) IN ADDITION TO DEVELOP AN EDUCATIONAL AND AWARENESS CAMPAIGN ARO

DESCRIPTION:THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (P.L. 117-58), ALSO KNOWN AS THE 'INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT OF 2021' (IIJA) OR 'BIL.' PROVIDED FIVE YEARS OF FUNDING FOR THE ACCELERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND COMMUNITY RESTORATION GOALS BY EACH OF THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAMS. A CORE EMPHASIS OF THE NEP BIL FUNDING IS THE ACCELERATION OF ENVIRONMENTAL AND COMMUNITY RESTORATION GOALS WITHIN THE CCMPS.  THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO HUDSON RIVER FOUNDATION FOR SCIENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESEARCH, INC. TO SUPPORT AND ACCELERATE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NY/NJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY' PROGRAM'S COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING ACTION PLAN PREPARED BY HUDSON RIVER FOUNDATION AND STAKEHOLDERS TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE NEW YORK-NEW JERSEY HARBOR AND ESTUARY. THIS AGREEMENT ALSO SUPPORTS THE URBAN WATERS FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP WHICH AIMS TO STIMULATE REGIONAL AND LOCAL ECONOMIES, ASSIST DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, CREATE LOCAL JOBS, IMPROVE QUALITY OF LIFE, AND PROTECT AMERICANS' HEALTH BY REVITALIZING URBAN WATERWAYS IN UNDER-SERVED COMMUNITIES ACROSS THE COUNTRY.  ACTIVITIES:THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED ARE SPECIFIED WITHIN THE NY-NJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY PROGRAM'S BIL PLANNING FRAMEWORK AND ANNUAL WORK PLAN AND BUDGET FOR FY 2022 AND FY 2023.  THE BIL PLANNING FRAMEWORK AND ANNUAL WORK PLAN AND BUDGET FOR FY 2022 AND FY 2023 IS ATTACHED TO THIS FUNDING RECOMMENDATION, AND SUPPORTS THE NYNJ HARBOR AND ESTUARY PROGRAMS 2017 - 2025 ACTION AGENDA. ACTIONS INCLUDED IN THE WORKPLAN INCLUDE SUPPORTING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, MONITOR PATHOGENS IN THE ESTUARY, PROVIDE GRANTS TO SUPPORT COMMUNITY RESILIENCE, INCREASE INVESTMENT IN CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION PROJECTS, INCREASE ACCESS TO THE WATERFRONT FOR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, FUND THE URBAN WATER PARTNERSHIP AMBASSADORS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES, AND PROVIDE AN IMPORTANT PLATFORM FOR COMMUNICATION BETWEEN FEDERAL, STATE, LOCAL AND NON-GOVERNMENTAL ORGANIZATION PARTNERS TO SUPPORT THE HEALTH OF THE ESTUARY.SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD ACTIVITIES TO BE FUNDED UNDER THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE:

1) ASSESS AND INTERPRET SHORELINE AND SHALLOW WATER HABITAT CONDITION AND VALUE THROUGH ENHANCEMENT AND CREATING STRUCTURED OYSTER REEFS.
2) INCREASE SUPPORT FOR MONITORING, ASSESSMENT AND INTERPRETATION OF SHALLOW WATER HABITAT CONDITION VALUE IN THE BRONX AND HARLEM RIVER AREAS.
3) ADVANCE OPPORTUNITIES FOR INCREASING PUBLIC ACCESS, PARTICULARLY IN AREAS OF HIGHER NEED.
4) SUPPORT STEWARDSHIP ACTIVITIES AND PUBLIC PROGRAMMING IN HIGHER NEED AREAS THROUGH SMALL GRANTS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.
5) INCREASE UNDERSTANDING  OF THE SAFETY AND RISKS ASSOCIATED WITH DIRECT CONTACT WITH ESTUARY WATERS BY SUPPORTING THE CREATION OF A WHITE PAPER THAT PROVIDES CLEAR, CONSISTENT AND CONSENSUS DRIVEN LANGUAGE.
6) ADVANCE IMPROVEMENTS TO THE LOWER PASSAIC RIVER SHORELINE TO IMPROVE PUBLIC ACCESS AND HABITAT VALUES.
7) SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE OPPORTUNITIES IN CSO AND MS4 COMMUNITIES.
8) DESIGN AND INTENSIVE PATHOGEN MONITORING AND NOTIFICATION PLAN ON THE ARTHUR KILL
9) IDENTIFY PARAMETERS AND POTENTIAL FOR ESTABLISHING A LONG TERM MONITORING PROGRAM TO ASSESS CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.
10) PROVIDE GRANTS TO DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO SUPPORT ENGAGEMENT IN CLIMATE RESILIENCY INITIATIVES TO ADDRESS WATER QUALITY ISSUES.
11) INCREASE INVESTMENT IN CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION BY ASSESSMENT OF ROAD STREAM CROSSINGS SUCH AS CULVERS AND BRIDGES FOR AQUATIC PASSAGE AND CLIMATE READINESS PRIORITIZING THOSE IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES.
12) INCREASE INVESTMENT IN CONSERVATION BY SUPPORTING MANAGEMENT AND PROTECTION OF WETLANDS ON THE HACKENSACK RIVER

DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING THROUGH THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) (ALSO KNOWN AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA)) FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EPA APPROVED DELAWARE ESTUARY PROGRAM COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) UNDER SECTION 320 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA), WHICH WILL HELP RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY AND ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE DELAWARE ESTUARY. THIS PROJECT OVERSEES THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS OUTLINED UNDER THE DELAWARE ESTUARY PROGRAM (DELEP) WORKPLAN,
THROUGH WHICH THE FEDERAL FUNDS AND OUTLINED ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENT THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM'S (NEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE DELEP CCMP.
ACTIVITIES:UNDER THIS AWARD, THE DELEP INTENDS TO IMPLEMENT ACTIONS RELATED TO ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF VARIOUS GOALS WITHIN THEIR CCMP. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE DRIVEN BY SPECIFIC PRIORITY GOALS, INCLUDING: DECREASING NUTRIENT LOADING THROUGHOUT THE WATERSHED; PRESERVING AND PROTECTING MARSHES, SHORELINES AND NEAR-SHORE HABITATS; FACILITATING AND MONITORING CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION PROJECTS; AND, EDUCATING THE PUBLIC TO SUPPORT KNOWLEDGEABLE DECISION-MAKING FOR THE COMMUNITY AND ITS FUTURE. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER
THIS AWARD INCLUDE: COASTAL HABITAT RESTORATION; WATER QUALITY MONITORING; PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH,;CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCY EFFORTS; LIVING SHORELINE IMPROVEMENTS; STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS; SUPPORTING DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES; SUPPORT OF THE URBAN WATERS INITIATIVES; AND MAINTAINING CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT CCMP GOALS.SUBRECIPIENT:THE RECIPIENT INTENDS TO MAKE SUBAWARDS TO ELIGIBLE ENTITIES TO UNDERTAKE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: EVALUATION OF FUNDING SOURCES/MECHANISMS FOR ESTUARY WASTEWATER TREATMENT PLANT IMPROVEMENTS FOR DISSOLVED OXYGEN INCREASES, ENHANCED MONITORING FOR NUTRIENTS, ENHANCEMENT OF EUTROPHICATION MODEL, ENHANCED MONITORING FOR TOXICS AND EMERGING CONTAMINANTS, EXTENSION OF LIVING SHORELINE SITE, DEVELOPMENT OF WEB BASED PLATFORM FOR PDE'S LIVING SHORELINE FEASIBILITY MODEL, CONVERSION OF WATER TREATMENT SETTLING TANK FOR USE AS MUSSEL REARING CENTER, SUPPORT OF PLANNING AND IMPLEMENTATION OF COMMUNITY-LED PROJECTS TO ADDRESS ENVIRONMENTAL CONCERNS IN URBAN WATER FEDERAL PARTNERSHIP COMMUNITIES, AND DEVELOPMENT OF COST-SHARE PROGRAM FOR GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECT DESIGN AND IMPLEMENTATION TO ENCOURAGE HOMEOWNERS TO INSTALL HABITAT IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES RELATED TO THIS AWARD INCLUDE REDUCING NUTRIENT POLLUTION AND ITS IMPACTS, REDUCING OTHER POLLUTANTS AND THEIR IMPACTS, SUSTAINING DRINKING WATER FLOW FOR DRINKING WATER AND ECOSYSTEMS, INCREASED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE AND ACCESS, IMPROVED PUBLIC AWARENESS AND STAKEHOLDER ENGAGEMENT, PREVENTING WETLAND LOSS, STEMMING FOREST LOSS, AND, INCREASED AND IMPROVED FISH AND SHELLFISH HABITAT.  THIS WILL INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF NATURAL SHORELINE TO ERODED AREAS, THE IMPROVEMENT OF STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IN UNDERSERVED AREAS, THE DESIGN OF VARIOUS HABITAT AND COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND STANDING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY GRANT PROGRAMS. 

OUTCOMES FROM THIS AWARD INCLUDE IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND GROWTH IN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP IN THE WATERSHED, INCREASED COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP AND BEHAVIOR CHANGE AROUND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND THE PRESERVATION/ENHANCEMENT OF WATER QUALITY, CRITICAL HABITAT AND COASTAL RESILIENCE RESOURCES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED, VISITORS TO THE DELAWARE ESTUARY, INDUSTRIES AND BUSINESSES THAT RELY ON THE BAY, DISADVANTAGED AND UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES, AND THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE.

THIS WILL INCLUDE THE INSTALLATION OF NATURAL SHORELINE TO ERODED AREAS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND STANDING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY GRANT PROGRAMS. OUTCOMES FROM THIS AWARD INCLUDE IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND GROWTH IN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP IN THE WATERSHED, INCREASED COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP AND BEHAVIOR CHANGE AROUND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND THE PRESERVATION/ENHANCEMENT OF WATER QUALITY, CRITICAL HABITAT AND COASTAL RESILIENCE RESOURCES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED, VISITORS TO THE INLAND BAYS ESTUARY, AND THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE.

DESCRIPTION:THIS AWARD PROVIDES FUNDING THROUGH THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) (ALSO KNOWN AS THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA)) FOR IMPLEMENTATION OF THE EPA APPROVED MARYLAND COASTAL BAYS COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) UNDER SECTION 320 OF THE CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA), WHICH WILL HELP RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE WATER QUALITY AND ECOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE MARYLAND COASTAL BAYS. THIS PROJECT OVERSEES THE IMPLEMENTATION OF PROJECTS OUTLINED UNDER MARYLAND COASTAL BAY'S (MCBP) WORKPLAN, THROUGH WHICH THE FEDERAL FUNDS AND OUTLINED ACTIVITIES IMPLEMENT THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM'S (NEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE PURPOSE OF THIS AWARD IS TO SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MCBP CCMP.ACTIVITIES:UNDER THIS AWARD, MCBP INTENDS TO IMPLEMENT ACTIONS RELATED TO 52 ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT THE IMPLEMENTATION OF VARIOUS GOALS WITHIN THEIR CCMP. THESE ACTIVITIES ARE DRIVEN BY SPECIFIC PRIORITY GOALS, INCLUDING: DECREASING NUTRIENT LOADING THROUGHOUT THE WATERSHED; PRESERVING AND PROTECTING MARSHES, SHORELINES AND NEAR-SHORE HABITATS; FACILITATING AND MONITORING CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION PROJECTS; AND, EDUCATING THE PUBLIC TO SUPPORT KNOWLEDGEABLE DECISION-MAKING FOR THE COMMUNITY AND ITS FUTURE. SPECIFIC ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED UNDER THIS AWARD INCLUDE: COASTAL HABITAT RESTORATION, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH, CLIMATE CHANGE RESILIENCY EFFORTS, LIVING SHORELINE IMPROVEMENTS, STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS, SUPPORTING DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES AND HBCU INSTITUTIONS, AND MAINTAINING CAPACITY TO IMPLEMENT CCMP GOALS.SUBRECIPIENT:WITH THE GOAL OF PROMOTING IDEAS AND PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS CLIMATE RESILIENCE- AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE-ORIENTED NEEDS, COMPETITIVE GRANTS OF VARIOUS SIZES WILL BE AWARDED TO CCMP PARTNERS AND OTHER STAKEHOLDERS IN THE WATERSHED. GRANTS MAY INCLUDE A MIX OF LARGER AWARDS FOR SIGNIFICANT PROJECT OR RESEARCH ACTIVITIES AND SMALLER AWARDS FOR MORE LIMITED PROJECTS BY SMALLER COMMUNITY ORGANIZATIONS. THE INTENTION IS TO RESERVE A CERTAIN PERCENTAGE OF GRANT FUNDING FOR PROJECTS/ORGANIZATIONS FOCUSED ON CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE ISSUES.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES RELATED TO THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE RESTORATION OF NONTIDAL WETLAND HABITAT FROM AGRICULTURAL LAND, THE INSTALLATION OF NATURAL SHORELINE TO ERODED AREAS, THE IMPROVEMENT OF STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE IN UNDERSERVED AREAS, THE DESIGN OF VARIOUS HABITAT AND COMMUNITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS, AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF NEW AND STANDING ENVIRONMENTAL EDUCATION AND COMMUNITY GRANT PROGRAMS. OUTCOMES FROM THIS AWARD INCLUDE IMPROVED ENVIRONMENTAL LITERACY AND GROWTH IN ENVIRONMENTAL STEWARDSHIP IN THE WATERSHED, INCREASED COMMUNITY STEWARDSHIP AND BEHAVIOR CHANGE AROUND ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES, AND THE PRESERVATION/ENHANCEMENT OF WATER QUALITY, CRITICAL HABITAT AND COASTAL RESILIENCE RESOURCES. INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS AWARD INCLUDE THE CITIZENS OF THE LOCAL WATERSHED, VISITORS TO THE EASTERN SHORE AND COASTAL BAYS, INDUSTRIES AND BUSINESSES THAT RELY ON THE COASTAL BAYS, STUDENTS AND FACULTY OF THE LOCAL SCHOOL SYSTEM AND OF UMES, AND THE LOCAL ECOSYSTEM AS A WHOLE.

DESCRIPTION:THE OBJECTIVE OF THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM WATERSHEDS GRANT PROGRAM (NEPWG) IS TO SUPPORT PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS URGENT, EMERGING, AND CHALLENGING ISSUES THAT THREATEN THE ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF ESTUARINE AREAS. RESTORE AMERICA'S ESTUARIES WILL MANAGE A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THAT WILL SOLICIT, AWARD AND ADMINISTER A NATIONAL COMPETITIVE SUBAWARD PROGRAM WITH SUBAWARDS BETWEEN $200,000 AND $500,000.ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED INCLUDE:
WORK WITH EPA AND THE SIX-MEMBER ADVISORY PROGRAM COMMITTEE, COMPRISED OF LEADERS IN THE PUBLIC, TRIBAL, AND NON-PROFIT SECTORS, RAE WILL DEVELOP A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS (RFP) THAT INTEGRATES THE GOALS AND PRIORITIES OF THE NEPWG PROGRAM.
PROMOTE THE NEPWG RFP BROADLY VIA EMAIL LISTS, SOCIAL MEDIA, AND NEWSLETTERS AND INCREASE TARGETED OUTREACH TO HISTORICALLY UNDERREPRESENTED COMMUNITIES AND ORGANIZATIONS,
UTILIZE A TWO-STAGE, COMPETITIVE APPLICATION PROCESS CONSISTING OF AN OPEN LETTER OF INTENT (LOI) SOLICITATION, FOLLOWED BY AN INVITATION-ONLY FULL PROPOSAL STAGE.
SELECT, OVERSEE, AND MANAGE SUBAWARDS THAT ADDRESS URGENT, EMERGING, AND CHALLENGING ENVIRONMENTAL ISSUES AND PRIORITIES.
OVERSEE AND MANAGE SUBAWARDS AND PROVIDE TECHNICAL SUPPORT TO SUBAWARDEES TO HELP ENSURE THE QUALITY OF PROJECT DATA AND ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS, AND QAPPS SUBMITTED BY SUBAWARDEES MEET EPA REQUIREMENTS.
INTEGRATE LEARNING AND KNOWLEDGE SHARING OPPORTUNITIES THROUGHOUT THEIR ADMINISTRATION OF NEPWG AND WILL CONVENE AT LEAST ONE LIVE LEARNING EXCHANGE WEBINAR ANNUALLY. 
QUALITATIVELY AND QUANTITATIVELY MEASURE, TRACK, AND REPORT THE OUTPUTS AND OUTCOMES OF THE ENVIRONMENTAL RESULTS OF THE NEP WATERSHEDS GRANT PROJECTS ACCOMPLISHED THROUGH THE COMPETITIVE SUBAWARDS.
CAPTURE THE DATA AND RESULTS, AND DOCUMENTING LESSONS LEARNED FROM THE SUBAWARD PROJECTS. PROGRESS REPORTS WILL DOCUMENT DATA RESULTS, ALONG WITH REFLECT ON LESSONS LEARNED.
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARD PROJECTS WILL ADDRESS URGENT, EMERGING, AND CHALLENGING ISSUES THAT THREATEN THE ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF ESTUARINE AREAS.  THE SUBAWARDS WILL SUPPORT ESTUARY PROTECTION AND RESTORATION SUBAWARD PROJECTS LOCATED ENTIRELY WITHIN THE IDENTIFIED NEP WATERSHEDS GRANT GEOGRAPHIC AREASOUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED OUTPUTS/DELIVERABLES MAY INCLUDE:
PROJECTS THAT ADDRESS URGENT AND CHALLENGING ISSUES THAT THREATEN ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING IN GEOGRAPHIC AREAS AS DEFINED BY THIS RFA FUNDED THROUGH SUBAWARDS.
PROJECTS THAT REMOVE OR MODIFY PHYSICAL BARRIERS THAT WOULD PREVENT NATURAL TRANSITION OF SALT MARSH HABITAT.
DEVELOPMENT AND VERIFICATION OF SUBAWARDEE TRACKING (REPORTING) SYSTEMS THAT INCLUDE THE ABILITY TO MONITOR PROGRESS AND TO UPLOAD REPORTS.
LESSONS LEARNED CAPTURED FROM THE SUBAWARD PROJECTS.
NUMBER OF ACRES, LINEAR MILES OR FEET OF HABITAT CREATED, RE-ESTABLISHED, REHABILITATED, OR ENHANCED FUNDED THROUGH SUBAWARD PROJECTS.

EXPECTED OUTCOMES MAY INCLUDE:
CHANGE(S) MADE TO REGULATIONS, CODES, AND/OR ORDINANCES TO PROMOTE ESTUARINE WATERSHED-BASED PROTECTION AND RESTORATION.
INCREASED CAPACITY AMONG STATE, LOCAL, REGIONAL, TRIBAL GOVERNMENTS ALONG WITH TYPICALLY UNDER-REPRESENTED AND/OR ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES TO ADDRESS URGENT, EMERGING, AND CHALLENGING ESTUARINE ISSUES.
IMPROVEMENT IN THE FUNCTION OF ESTUARINE, NEAR-SHORE, WETLAND, AND UPLAND HABITAT COMMUNITIES.
INCREASE IN THE QUALITY OF HABITAT THAT WAS IMPAIRED BY NON-NATIVE INVASIVE SPECIES.
CHANGE(S) IN BEHAVIOR OF COMMUNITY MEMBERS THAT RESULTS IN IMPROVED CONDITIONS IN ESTUARINE WATERS OR BOLSTERS RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE CHANGE.

INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE ESTUARINE WATERSHED COMMUNITIES AND STAKEHOLDERS LOCATED IN THE NEPWG GEOGRAPHIC AREAS.

THE OBJECTIVE OF THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM COASTAL WATERSHED GRANT (NEPCWG) IS TO SUPPORT EFFORTS TO ADDRESS URGENT AND CHALLENGING THREATS TO COASTAL AND ESTUARINE AREAS. RESTORE AMERICA'S ESTUARIES (RAE) WILL MANAGE A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT THAT WILL SOLICIT, AWARD AND ADMINISTER COMPETITIVE SUBAWARD GRANTS  BETWEEN $75,000 AND $250,000. THE OVERARCHING GOAL OF THIS PROJECT IS TO REDUCE THREATS TO THE ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF COASTAL AND ESTUARINE AREAS BY ADVANCING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF NEP COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLANS (CCMPS) AND/OR STATE OR LOCAL-APPROVED WATERSHED MANAGEMENT PLANS WITHIN THE GEOGRAPHIC AREAS DEFINED AS NEP COASTAL WATERSHEDS.

DESCRIPTION:THE GRANTEE WILL INVEST NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) FUNDING TO PROVIDE DIRECT SUPPORT AND ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL PARTNERS TO IMPLEMENT TRANSFORMATIONAL, LANDSCAPE-SCALE PROJECTS THAT WILL ADVANCE LOCALLY DETERMINED PRIORITIES FOR IMPLEMENTING THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP), ALSO REFERRED TO AS THE ACTION AGENDA ACROSS THE PUGET SOUND REGION. FURTHERMORE, THIS FUNDING SUPPORTS FEDERAL AND STATE AGENCIES COORDINATING THEIR PROGRAMS AND SPENDING IN A SYNCHRONIZED FASHION, AND PROVIDES TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL PARTNERS AND TRIBES TO PREPARE PROPOSALS THAT PUT VARIOUS RECOVERY AND PROTECTION PIECES TOGETHER. THIS FUNDING WILL CONTRIBUTE TO ACHIEVING A MULTI-BENEFIT APPROACH, AS THE GRANTEE SUPPORTS THE EFFORTS OF THE RECOVERY COMMUNITY TO THINK, PLAN, AND ACT ACROSS SECTORS AND GEOGRAPHIES TO ALIGN TRANSPORTATION, LAND USE, HABITAT RESTORATION AND PROTECTION, AGRICULTURE, FLOOD HAZARD REDUCTION, AND STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE. THE NEP IIJA FUNDING WILL SUPPORT ALL GOALS OF THE ACTION AGENDA, BY ACQUIRING FUNDING FOR IMPLEMENTATION AND ACHIEVING THE DESIRED OUTCOMES.ACTIVITIES:THE RECIPIENT WILL COORDINATE WITH TRIBES AND LOCAL PARTNERS TO USE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) FUNDS TO FORM A TEAM MADE UP OF TWO GROUPS. THE LEVERAGING FUNDING GROUP WILL FOCUS ON GENERATING INVESTMENT TO IMPLEMENT LOCAL PRIORITIES BY LEVERAGING THE UNPRECEDENTED OPPORTUNITIES THROUGH THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) AND THE INFLATION REDUCTION ACT (IRA) AS WELL AS STATE OF WASHINGTON INITIATIVES SUCH AS THE CLIMATE COMMITMENT ACT. THE BARRIERS REMOVAL GROUP WILL FOCUS ON SUPPORTING TRIBES AND LOCAL PARTNERS TO REMOVE BARRIERS TO SUCCESSFULLY IMPLEMENT THEIR LOCAL RECOVERY PRIORITIES IN THE ACTION AGENDA.  WITHOUT A FOCUS ON ADDRESSING BARRIERS, INVESTMENTS IN PUGET SOUND RECOVERY WILL NOT BE EFFECTIVE OR TIMELY.SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:THIS PROJECT WILL RESULT IN THE FOLLOWING OUTCOMES:  USE THE RECENTLY APPROVED 2022-2026 PUGET SOUND ACTION AGENDA, AS THE NEP FUNDING AUTHORITY, TO HELP FOCUS AND INFLUENCE FEDERAL AND STATE PROGRAMS THAT WILL BE DISBURSING THESE FUNDS TO MAKE INVESTMENTS TOWARDS GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS THAT SUPPORT PUGET SOUND RECOVERY OUTCOMES AND LOCAL PRIORITIES. PROVIDE TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO LOCAL PARTNERS TO DEVELOP TRANSFORMATIVE, LANDSCAPE-SCALE INITIATIVES, INCLUDING COORDINATION ACROSS JURISDICTIONS. IDENTIFY FUNDING OPPORTUNITIES FOR LOCAL AND REGIONAL PRIORITIES AND SUCCESSFULLY ACQUIRE RESOURCES BY STRATEGICALLY LEVERAGING IIJA AND OTHER SOURCES OF FUNDING TO IMPLEMENT THE ACTION AGENDA. IMPLEMENT LOCAL PRIORITIES IN THE ACTION AGENDA BY SUPPORTING LOCAL PARTNERS TO REDUCE OR ELIMINATE GAPS AND BARRIERS, AND ADVANCE GOALS TARGETED TO EQUITY, CLIMATE, AND RESILIENT (NATURE-BASED) INFRASTRUCTURE.

DESCRIPTION:THE LOWER COLUMBIA ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (LCEP) UNDERTAKES THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THEIR TWO- YEAR WORKPLAN USING CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 320 FUNDS FOR THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM. IN THEIR 2022-2023 BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) FUNDED BUDGET, THESE FUNDS ARE PRIMARILY PROJECTED TO SUPPORT A TOTAL OF 3.5 FTE OF THEIR PROJECTED 27.05 FTE OF AVAILABLE LCEP STAFF RESOURCES THAT ARE IMPLEMENTING THEIR EPA APPROVED COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND INCLUDES ACTIVITIES THAT ARE RELATED ACHIEVING THEIR OVERALL MANAGEMENT GOALS INCLUDING ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS TO: INCREASE HABITAT AND HABITAT FUNCTION FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES; RESTORE 25,000 ACRES OF HABITAT BY 2025, CONSERVE LAND TO PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT; REDUCE IMPACTS FROM LAND USE PRACTICES; REDUCE ARMORED SHORELINE BY 10% BY 2025; MAINTAIN IMPERVIOUS SURFACE AT NO MORE THAN 15%; REDUCE OR REMOVE CONTAMINANTS AND CLEAN-UP CONTAMINATED SITES TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY; PROVIDE EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WHILE PROVIDING STATE OF THE ART DATA AND INFORMATION FOR A RANGE OF AUDIENCES; REACH 5,000 STUDENTS EACH YEAR AND HOST AT LEAST TEN VOLUNTEER EVENTS EACH YEAR, WHILE CONVENING AND COORDINATING WITH PARTNERS TO ENHANCE REGIONAL STRATEGIES AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT HEIGHTEN PROTECTION OF THE LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER.ACTIVITIES:LCEP PROPOSES TO FOCUS ON SEVERAL BROAD PROJECT TYPES DURING THE LIFE OF THE BIL FUNDING, THOSE PROJECT TYPES INCLUDE: HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS OF VARYING SIZE AND COMPLEXITY THAT ARE INTENDED TO IDENTIFY, PROTECT, CONSERVE, AND ENHANCE PRIORITY HABITATS THROUGHOUT THE ESTUARY. WATER TRAIL NON-MOTORIZED BOAT ACCESS AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS THAT ARE FOCUSED ON EDUCATION AND STEWARDSHIP, WITH EMPHASIS ON IMPROVING PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER. STORMWATER AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS INTENDED TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND REDUCE CONTAMINATES TO THE LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER STUDY AREA. ASSESSMENT AND MONITORING PROJECTS INTENDED TO PROVIDE DATA ON THE STATUS AND TRENDS OF ECOSYSTEM CONDITIONS IN THE ESTUARY; EXPAND REGIONAL MONITORING OF TOXIC AND CONVENTIONAL POLLUTANTS; AND EXPAND KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING OF THE VALUE OF BLUE CARBON WITHIN THE ESTUARY. 
SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:SPECIFIC BENEFITS WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING POTENTIAL BENEFITS: INCREASED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT OF DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES; INCREASED FLOODPLAIN MITIGATION BENEFITS; GREEN STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE; COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND TRAINING; ABANDONED GRAVEL MINE LANDS; AND INCREASE COMMUNITY RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE CHANGE. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASE HABITAT AND HABITAT FUNCTION FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES; RESTORING 25,000 ACRES OF HABITAT BY 2025, IDENTIFYING AND CONSERVING LAND NEEDED TO PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT; HELPING TO REDUCE IMPACTS FROM LAND USE PRACTICES; REDUCING ARMORED SHORELINE BY 10% BY 2025; MAINTAINING IMPERVIOUS SURFACE AT NO MORE THAN 15%; CONDUCTING MONITORING ACTIVITIES THAT ARE INTENDED TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO REDUCE OR REMOVE CONTAMINANTS AND CLEAN-UP CONTAMINATED SITES TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY; PROVIDING
EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WHILE PROVIDING STATE OF THE ART DATA AND INFORMATION FOR A RANGE OF AUDIENCES; REACHING UP TO 5,000 STUDENTS EACH YEAR AND HOSTING AT LEAST TEN VOLUNTEER EVENTS EACH YEAR, WHILE CONVENING AND COORDINATING WITH PARTNERS TO ENHANCE REGIONAL STRATEGIES AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT HEIGHTEN PROTECTION OF THE LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER AND ASSOCIATED AQUATIC RESOURCES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT AND NATIONAL PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF OREGON AND WASHINGTON THAT LIVE, WORK AND RECREATE ALONG THE 146 MILES OF THE LOWER COLUMBIA RIVER AND ITS CONNECTED ESTUARY.

DESCRIPTION:THE TILLAMOOK ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (TEP) UNDERTAKES THE ACTIVITIES DESCRIBED IN THEIR TWO- YEAR WORKPLAN USING CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 320 FUNDS FOR THE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM. IN THEIR 2022-2023 BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) FUNDED BUDGET, THESE FUNDS ARE PRIMARILY PROJECTED TO PROVIDE PARTIAL SUPPORT FOR A TOTAL OF 5 FTE OF THEIR PROJECTED 10.5 FTE OF AVAILABLE TEP STAFF RESOURCES THAT ARE IMPLEMENTING THEIR EPA APPROVED COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION MANAGEMENT PLAN, AND INCLUDES ACTIVITIES THAT ARE RELATED ACHIEVING THEIR OVERALL MANAGEMENT GOALS INCLUDING ACTIVITIES AND PROJECTS TO: INCREASE HABITAT AND HABITAT FUNCTION FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES; RESTORING UP TO 10,000 ACRES OF HABITAT BY 2025, CONSERVING LAND TO PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT; REDUCING IMPACTS FROM LAND USE PRACTICES; REDUCING ARMORED SHORELINE BY UP TO 10% BY 2025; REDUCING CONTAMINANTS TO IMPROVE OVERALL WATER QUALITY; PROVIDING EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WHILE PROVIDING STATE OF THE ART DATA AND INFORMATION FOR A RANGE OF AUDIENCES; REACHING UP TO 5,000 STUDENTS EACH YEAR AND HOSTING AT LEAST TEN DIFFERENT VOLUNTEER EVENTS EACH YEAR, WHILE CONVENING AND COORDINATING WITH PARTNERS TO ENHANCE REGIONAL STRATEGIES AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT HEIGHTEN PROTECTION OF THE TILLAMOOK ESTUARY STUDY AREA.ACTIVITIES:TEP PROPOSES TO FOCUS ON SEVERAL BROAD PROJECT TYPES DURING THE LIFE OF THE BIL FUNDING, THOSE PROJECT TYPES INCLUDE: HABITAT RESTORATION PROJECTS OF VARYING SIZE AND COMPLEXITY THAT ARE INTENDED TO IDENTIFY, PROTECT, CONSERVE, AND ENHANCE PRIORITY HABITATS THROUGHOUT THE ESTUARY. WATER TRAIL NON-MOTORIZED BOAT ACCESS AND INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS THAT ARE FOCUSED ON EDUCATION AND STEWARDSHIP, WITH EMPHASIS ON IMPROVING PUBLIC ACCESS TO THE TILLAMOOK ESTUARY. STORMWATER AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE PROJECTS INTENDED TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND REDUCE CONTAMINATES TO THE TILLAMOOK BAY STUDY AREA. ASSESSMENT AND MONITORING PROJECTS INTENDED TO PROVIDE DATA ON THE STATUS AND TRENDS OF ECOSYSTEM CONDITIONS IN THE ESTUARY; EXPAND REGIONAL MONITORING OF WATER QUALITY AND CONVENTIONAL POLLUTANTS; AND EXPAND KNOWLEDGE AND UNDERSTANDING THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE WITHIN THE ESTUARY. SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE MADE BY TEP THROUGH DEVELOPMENT OF A LOCAL GRANT PROGRAM TO FUND LOCAL SMALL-SCALE RESTORATION OR WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENT PROJECTS.  OUTCOMES:SPECIFIC BENEFITS WILL FOCUS ON THE FOLLOWING POTENTIAL BENEFITS: INCREASED TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE AND COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT OF DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES; INCREASED FLOODPLAIN MITIGATION BENEFITS; GREEN STORMWATER INFRASTRUCTURE; COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT AND TRAINING; AND INCREASED COMMUNITY RESILIENCE TO CLIMATE CHANGE. ANTICIPATED OUTCOMES INCLUDE: INCREASE HABITAT AND HABITAT FUNCTION FOR MULTIPLE SPECIES; RESTORING UP TO 10,000 ACRES OF HABITAT BY 2025, IDENTIFYING AND CONSERVING LAND NEEDED TO PROTECT WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT; HELPING TO REDUCE IMPACTS FROM LAND USE PRACTICES; REDUCING ARMORED SHORELINE BY UP TO 10% BY 2025; CONDUCTING MONITORING ACTIVITIES THAT ARE INTENDED TO IDENTIFY OPPORTUNITIES TO REDUCE OR REMOVE CONTAMINANTS AND CLEAN-UP CONTAMINATED SITES TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY; PROVIDING EDUCATION AND ENGAGEMENT ACTIVITIES WHILE PROVIDING STATE OF THE ART DATA AND INFORMATION FOR A RANGE OF AUDIENCES; REACHING UP TO 5,000 STUDENTS EACH YEAR AND HOSTING AT LEAST TEN VOLUNTEER EVENTS EACH YEAR, WHILE CONVENING AND COORDINATING WITH PARTNERS TO ENHANCE REGIONAL STRATEGIES AND PARTNERSHIPS THAT HEIGHTEN PROTECTION OF THE TILLAMOOK ESTUARY STUDY AREA AND ASSOCIATED AQUATIC RESOURCES. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS GRANT AND NATIONAL PROGRAM ARE THE CITIZENS OF OREGON THAT LIVE, WORK AND RECREATE WITHIN THE TILLAMOOK BAY AND ITS CONNECTED ESTUARIES AND TRIBUTARIES.

DESCRIPTION:THESE FUNDS FOR THE BARATARIA-TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (BTNEP) SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE BARATARIA TERREBONNE ESTUARY. THIS AGREEMENT IS SUPPORTED BY FUNDING PROVIDED UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58).ACTIVITIES:ALL ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON MAINTAINING, RESTORING, AND/OR IMPROVING WATER QUALITY. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED BY BTNEP INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:
1) BAYOU LAFOURCHE AND BAYOU FOLSE WATERSHED HOME SEWAGE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM - ASSIST HOMEOWNERS WITH SEWAGE REPAIRS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES 2) CANAL BACKFILL AND WETLANDS RESTORATION PROJECT - RESTORE WETLANDS BY BACKFILLING A CANAL AND PROTECTING NATIVE LANDS 3) ESTABLISHING LONG-TERM BIOLOGICAL MONITORING SITES IN BARATARIA BASIN - ESTABLISH LONG-TERM MONITORING SITES TO ASSESS CHANGES TO THE FINFISH AND CRUSTACEAN COMMUNITIES 4) CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PUBLIC BOAT LAUNCH AND PARK ON BAYOU LAFOURCHE PHASE 1 - PROVIDE MORE EQUITABLE ACCESS TO A PUBLIC WATERWAY IN A DISADVANTAGED AREA OF THE ESTUARY AND MAKE EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL AMENITIES AVAILABLE AND MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THIS COMMUNITY 5) INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL INSTALLATION AT NEW COASTAL CENTER - INSTALL AN INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL INSTALLATION AT THE NEW COASTAL CENTER AT NICHOLLS STATE UNIVERSITY THAT WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC TO LEARN ABOUT THE ESTUARY 6) DOCUMENTARY ON CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECT ON THE NATIVE AMERICAN BAYOU COMMUNITY - SPONSOR DOCUMENTARY, CREATE AWARENESS AND CREATE DISCUSSION FORUMS/OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIALOGUES ON THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON INDIGENOUS PEOPLE AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN THE BARATARIA-TERREBONNE ESTUARY. SUBRECIPIENT:ALL PROJECTS WILL UTILIZE SUBAWARDS. BELOW ARE THE ACTIVITIES THAT WILL BE IMPLEMENTED THROUGH SUBAWARDS: 
1) BAYOU LAFOURCHE AND BAYOU FOLSE WATERSHED HOME SEWAGE ASSISTANCE PROGRAM - ASSIST HOMEOWNERS WITH SEWAGE REPAIRS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES 2) CANAL BACKFILL AND WETLANDS RESTORATION PROJECT - RESTORE WETLANDS BY BACKFILLING A CANAL AND PROTECTING NATIVE LANDS 3) ESTABLISHING LONG-TERM BIOLOGICAL MONITORING SITES IN BARATARIA BASIN - ESTABLISH LONG-TERM MONITORING SITES TO ASSESS CHANGES TO THE FINFISH AND CRUSTACEAN COMMUNITIES 4) CONSTRUCTION OF NEW PUBLIC BOAT LAUNCH AND PARK ON BAYOU LAFOURCHE PHASE 1 - PROVIDE MORE EQUITABLE ACCESS TO A PUBLIC WATERWAY IN A DISADVANTAGED AREA OF THE ESTUARY AND MAKE EDUCATIONAL AND RECREATIONAL AMENITIES AVAILABLE AND MORE ACCESSIBLE TO THIS COMMUNITY 5) INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL INSTALLATION AT NEW COASTAL CENTER - INSTALL AN INTERACTIVE EDUCATIONAL INSTALLATION AT THE NEW COASTAL CENTER AT NICHOLLS STATE UNIVERSITY THAT WILL ALLOW THE PUBLIC TO LEARN ABOUT THE ESTUARY 6) DOCUMENTARY ON CLIMATE CHANGE EFFECT ON THE NATIVE AMERICAN BAYOU COMMUNITY - SPONSOR DOCUMENTARY, CREATE AWARENESS AND CREATE DISCUSSION FORUMS/OPPORTUNITIES FOR DIALOGUES ON THE EFFECTS OF CLIMATE CHANGE ON INDIGENOUS PEOPLE AND TRIBAL COMMUNITIES IN THE BARATARIA-TERREBONNE ESTUARY. OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES TO BE PROVIDED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE: SEMI AND ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS, AND FINAL PROJECT REPORTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES RESULTING FROM THESE EFFORTS INCLUDE RESTORING LOUISIANA'S IMPAIRED WATERS AND PROTECTING HEALTHY WATERS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE THE BARATARIA-TERREBONNE AREA, HUMAN HEALTH, THE ENVIRONMENT AND ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

DESCRIPTION:THESE FUNDS FOR COASTAL BEND BAYS AND ESTUARIES PROGRAM (CBBEP) SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE COASTAL BEND BAYS AND ESTUARIES. THIS AGREEMENT IS SUPPORTED BY FUNDING PROVIDED UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58).ACTIVITIES:ALL ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON MAINTAINING, RESTORING, AND/OR IMPROVING WATER QUALITY. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED BY THE COASTAL BEND ANDBAY ESTUARY PROGRAM INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES:
1) TERN ISLAND PROTECTION AND RESTORATION, PHASE II - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF BIRD NESTING HABITAT ON TERN ISLAND BY (1) COMPLETING THE ENGINEERING DESIGN, PERMITTING, AND CONSTRUCTION OF A ROCK BREAKWATER AROUND THE PERIMETER OF THE ISLAND AND (2) EXPANDING THE ACREAGE OF TERN ISLAND THROUGH THE PLACEMENT OF IMPORTED FILL MATERIAL BEHIND THE NEWLY CONSTRUCTED BREAKWATERS.
2) COPANO BAY SHORELINE PROTECTION AND RESTORATION, PHASE I - THE OBJECTIVE OF THIS PROJECT IS TO COMPLETE A FEASIBILITY STUDY AND ALTERNATIVES ANALYSIS FOR AN ERODING SHORELINE IN COPANO BAY.
3) OSSF ASSISTANCE PROGRAM, PHASE I - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ADDRESS NUTRIENT AND BACTERIA PROBLEMS IN TARGETED WATERSHEDS BY INSPECTING, REPAIRING, AND REPLACING OSSFS THAT ARE FAILING OR NON-EXISTENT, FOCUSING ON UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITH LIMITED RESOURCES.
4) TRAINING PROGRAM FOR WASTEWATER OPERATORS IN THE BAFFIN BAY WATERSHED - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ADDRESS NUTRIENT AND BACTERIA PROBLEMS IN THE BAFFIN BAY WATERSHED BY IMPLEMENTING A 24-MONTH TRAINING PROGRAM FOR PERSONNEL AT WASTEWATER FACILITIES, FOCUSING ON INCREASING THE HUMAN CAPITAL OF UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES WITH LIMITED RESOURCES.
5) ACCESS IMPROVEMENTS AND TRAIL DEVELOPMENT AT THE HELD-MORAN SANCTUARY - THE OBJECTIVES  INCLUDE (1) CONSTRUCTING OFF-STREET, GRAVEL PARKING LOT ON THE NORTH SIDE OF THE HELD-MORAN SANCTUARY ON MEDITERRANEAN DRIVE WITH ENOUGH SPACE FOR FOUR TO FIVE CARS; (2) DESIGNING AND INSTALLING A HALF-MILE LOOP-TRAIL, ORIENTED NORTH TO SOUTH, FROM THE PROPOSED PARKING AREA; AND (3) REPAIRING AND REPLACING DAMAGED BOLLARD AND CABLE SYSTEM THAT IS DESIGNED TO LIMIT ACCESS TO THE INTERIOR OF THE PROPERTY BY MOTORIZED AND/OR WHEELED VEHICLES.
6) ARANSAS BAY BIRD ISLAND RESTORATION, PHASE II - THE OBJECTIVES ARE TO INCREASE THE AMOUNT OF BIRD NESTING HABITAT IN THE ARANSAS BAY SYSTEM BY (1) COMPLETING THE FINAL ENGINEERING/DESIGN AND CONSTRUCTION OF A ROCK BREAKWATER AROUND THE PERIMETER OF DEADMAN ISLAND AND (2) EXPANDING THE ACREAGE OF THE ISLAND THROUGH THE PLACEMENT OF IMPORTED FILL MATERIAL BEHIND THE NEWLY CONSTRUCTED BREAKWATERS.
7) TOWN OF BAYSIDE SHORELINE PROTECTION AND PUBLIC ACCESS, PHASE II - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO COMPLETE THE PRELIMINARY ENGINEERING AND DESIGN AND PERMITTING FOR A SHORELINE PROTECTION STRUCTURES NEAR THE TOWN OF BAYSIDE. THE PROJECT WILL SEEK TO REDUCE AND PREVENT EROSION OVER TIME AT BAYSIDE CITY PARK, WHILE ALSO CREATING AND RESTORING HABITAT FOR AQUATIC AND AVIAN SPECIES AND IMPROVING PUBLIC ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES.
8) CBBEP CLIMATE CHANGE RISK-BASED ADAPTATION PLAN AND EQUITY STRATEGY - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO DEVELOP A CLIMATE CHANGE RISK-BASED ADAPTATION PLAN THAT CONTAINS EFFECTIVE SOLUTIONS THAT CBBEP AND OUR PARTNERS CAN IMPLEMENT TO BETTER MANAGE POTENTIAL RISKS FROM A CHANGING CLIMATE. THE PROJECT WILL ALSO FOCUS ON DEVELOPING AN EQUITY STRATEGY THAT ENSURES CBBEP IS REVIEWING POTENTIAL PROJECTS AND UTILIZATION OF OUR FUNDS THROUGH LENS OF EQUITABLE AND FAIR ACCESS FROM OUR PROGRAMS TO ALL INDIVIDUALS.
9) COASTAL BEND REGIONAL WASTEWATER TREATMENT FACILITY FEASIBILITY STUDY - THE OBJECTIVE IS TO ADDRESS NUTRIENT AND BACTERIA PROBLEMS IN THE BAFFIN BAY WATERSHED BY CONDUCTING A FEASIBILITY STUDY FOR THE PROPOSED CONSTRUCTION OF A REGIONAL WAS

DESCRIPTION:THESE FUNDS TO THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S (TCEQ) GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (GBEP) PROVIDE SUPPORT IN IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN. THIS AGREEMENT IS SUPPORTED BY FUNDING PROVIDED UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58).ACTIVITIES:ALL ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON MAINTAINING, RESTORING, AND/OR IMPROVING WATER QUALITY THROUGH A VARIETY OF METHODS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LAND CONSERVATION, WATER QUALITY IMPLEMENTATION OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, AND ESTUARY RESTORATION. THE ACTIVITIES TO BE PERFORMED BY THE GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (GBEP) INCLUDE THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: 1) DEVELOPMENT OF A LONG-TERM PLAN AND EQUITY STRATEGY; 2) REPAIR AND REPLACEMENT OF FAILING ON-SITE SEWAGE FACILITIES FOR HOMEOWNERS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITH VULNERABLE POPULATIONS; 3) ACQUISITION AND PRESERVATION OF 1,065 ACRES OF HABITAT ALONG ARMAND BAYOU NORTH OF THE ARMAND BAYOU NATURE CENTER'S 2,500 ACRE PRESERVE; 4) ACQUISITION AND RESTORATION OF 25 ACRES OF REMNANT COASTAL PRAIRIE AND CREATION OF PUBLIC ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY OF SAN LEON, TEXAS; 5) RESTORATION OF 45.5 ACRES OF COASTAL PRAIRIE, RIPARIAN, WETLAND, AND SAVANNAH HABITAT IN HOUSTON, TEXAS; 6) CONDUCT TRASH CLEAN-UPS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS WITH SCHOOLS, LIBRARIES, NATURE CENTERS, AND VISITOR CENTERS; AND 7) COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. 

SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTATION OF AN APPROVED COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY, INCLUDING OUTREACH, EDUCATION, CONSERVATION AND RESTORATION ACTIVITIES THAT WORK TOWARDS PROTECTING AND RESTORING THE UNIQUE ESTUARY ECOSYSTEM. SUBAWARDS FOR THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOCAL AREA-WIDE AGENCIES, CITY OF HOUSTON, GALVESTON BAY FOUNDATION, CONSERVANCIES AND NATURE CENTERS.

ALL OF THE FUNDS ARE PASSED THOUGH AS SUBAWARDS. SUBAWARDEES WILL BE CONDUCTING THE FOLLOWING ACTIVITIES: 1) DEVELOPMENT OF A LONG-TERM PLAN AND EQUITY STRATEGY; 2) REPAIR AND REPLACEMENT OF FAILING ON-SITE SEWAGE FACILITIES FOR HOMEOWNERS IN DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES WITH VULNERABLE POPULATIONS; 3) ACQUISITION AND PRESERVATION OF 1,065 ACRES OF HABITAT ALONG ARMAND BAYOU NORTH OF THE ABNC'S 2,500 ACRE PRESERVE;4)  ACQUISITION AND RESTORATION OF 25 ACRES OF REMNANT COASTAL PRAIRIE AND CREATION OF PUBLIC ACCESS OPPORTUNITIES FOR THE COMMUNITY OF SAN LEON, TEXAS; 5) RESTORATION OF 45.5 ACRES OF COASTAL PRAIRIE, RIPARIAN, WETLAND, AND SAVANNAH HABITAT IN HOUSTON, TEXAS; 6) CONDUCT TRASH CLEAN-UPS AND EDUCATION PROGRAMS WITH SCHOOLS, LIBRARIES, NATURE CENTERS, AND VISITOR CENTERS; AND 7) COMMUNITY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION. 

OUTCOMES:THE DELIVERABLES TO BE PROVIDED UNDER THIS AGREEMENT ARE: SEMI AND ANNUAL PROGRESS REPORTS, QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLANS AND FINAL PROJECT REPORTS. THE EXPECTED OUTCOMES RESULTING FROM THESE EFFORTS INCLUDE RESTORING TEXAS' IMPAIRED WATERS AND PROTECTING HEALTHY WATERS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE GALVESTON BAY AREA, HUMAN HEALTH, THE ENVIRONMENT AND ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,819,600 FOR CHARLOTTE COUNTY TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES WITHIN THE COASTAL AND HEARTLAND NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (CHNEP). CHNEP WILL CONTINUE TO ACTIVELY PARTICIPATE IN GATHERING DATA AND SUPPORTING MODELING AND ANALYSES AS WELL AS FUND INTEGRATED GROUND AND SURFACE WATER MODELS TO IMPROVE DECISION-MAKING WITH REGARDS TO HYDROLOGICAL RESTORATION PROJECTS. CURRENTLY, THESE INCLUDE THE SOUTH LEE COUNTY WATERSHED INITIATIVE AND THE CHARLOTTE HARBOR FLATWOODS INITIATIVE PROJECTS. THIS AGREEMENT IS SUPPORTED BY FUNDING PROVIDED UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58).ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE PROTECTING AND RESTORING CRITICAL HABITATS, INCLUDING WETLANDS, AND ADDRESSING CHALLENGING ISSUES THAT THREATEN THE ECOLOGICAL AND ECONOMIC WELL-BEING OF NEP WATERSHEDS AND COMMUNITIES; SUPPORTING WATER QUALITY PROTECTION AND RESTORATION, INCLUDING TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD PLAN IMPLEMENTATION;	MONITORING AND ADDRESSING TOXICS, PATHOGEN LOADS AND CONTAMINATION; IMPLEMENTING STORMWATER MANAGEMENT PRACTICES THAT REDUCE NON-POINT SOURCE POLLUTION IMPACTS; PROMOTING THE ADOPTION OF GREEN AND NATURE-BASED INFRASTRUCTURE APPROACHES; PREVENTING THE SPREAD OF AQUATIC INVASIVE SPECIES AND/OR MANAGING THEIR IMPACTS; DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING NUTRIENT REDUCTION STRATEGIES; MEASURING, MONITORING, AND INCREASING CARBON SEQUESTRATION; CONDUCTING CLIMATE VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS, DEVELOPING, AND IMPLEMENTING CLIMATE CHANGE ADAPTATION STRATEGIES AND USING ADAPTATION TOOLS TO PROMOTE COASTAL RESILIENCE; AND DEVELOPING AND IMPLEMENTING STRATEGIES TO INCREASE OPPORTUNITIES FOR DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES TO ACCESS, ENJOY, AND BENEFIT FROM SURFACE WATERS AND WATERWAYS, PARTICIPATE IN ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION, AND ENGAGE IN CAPACITY-BUILDING OR EDUCATIONAL ACTIVITIES. NEPS MAY ALSO USE FUNDS TO SUPPORT OTHER ACTIVITIES IDENTIFIED IN THE  CCMP, INCLUDING PROJECTS THAT BUILD ORGANIZATIONAL OR FINANCIAL CAPACITY. NEP REGIONAL COORDINATORS CAN ANSWER SPECIFIC QUESTIONS ON ELIGIBLE USES.SUBRECIPIENT:CHARLOTTE COUNTY CLIMATE CHANGE VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENT; POLK COUNTY CLIMATE CHANGE VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENT; PINE ISLAND FLATWOODS RESTORATION; CHNEP WATER ATLAS - MAINTENANCE AND IMPROVEMENTS; OTHER CLIMATE CHANGE VULNERABILITY ASSESSMENTS TBD AND RESTORATION PROJECTS TBD.OUTCOMES:OUTCOMES AND OUTPUTS INCLUDE STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND NON-POINT SOURCE PROJECTS, AS WELL AS WATER AND GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE WHICH MAY INCORPORATE DEVELOPMENT OF ADAPTATION OR HAZARD MITIGATION PLANS TO ADDRESS CLIMATE CHANGE AND RESILIENCY, ONGOING COLLABORATE WITH PARTNERS ON CCMP IMPLEMENTATION, COMPLIANCE WITH HOST AGENCY FINANCE AND PROCUREMENT REQUIREMENTS, COMPLIANCE WITH FUNDERS' GRANT REPORTING REQUIREMENTS. THE CITIZENS OF FLORIDA WILL BE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.

DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $1,819,600 FOR THE SARASOTA BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (SBEP) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES WITHIN THE SARASOTA BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM. THE PROJECTS PROPOSED FOR FUNDING VIA THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW(BIL) WILL LEVERAGE EXISTING EFFORTS, SO THAT THE SBEP WILL SPEND BIL DOLLARS ON PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION, RATHER THAN THE EARLIER STAGES OF DESIGN AND PERMITTING. THIS AGREEMENT IS SUPPORTED BY FUNDING PROVIDED UNDER THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58.ACTIVITIES:SARASOTA BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (SBEP) WILL CONTINUE EFFORTS TO COORDINATE EFFORTS AMONG OUR STAKEHOLDERS TO DEVELOP A LOCALLY LED, SCIENTIFICALLY SOUND WATER QUALITY AND ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION PROGRAM FOR THE BAY. TO COMPLETE HABITAT RESTORATION EFFORTS AT TWO SITES, FISH PRESERVE PHASE IV AND GT BRAY PARK, AND TO ALLOW THE SBEP TO CONTINUE ITS LONG-RUNNING EFFORTS TO SUPPLEMENT THE BAY'S ECOSYSTEM HEALTH THROUGH THE DEPLOYMENT OF SPECIALLY DESIGNED ARTIFICIAL REEFS.  EACH PROJECT IS DESCRIBED BELOW IN TERMS OF ITS RELEVANCE TO CCMP GOALS, A SUMMARY BUDGET, A BRIEF DESCRIPTION OF THE PROJECT, THE LEADS AND/OR PARTNERS INVOLVED IN THE PROJECT, AND ESTIMATED MILESTONES.SUBRECIPIENT:FISH PRESERVE MANAGEMENT; FISH PRESERVE PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH; GT BRAY PARK PROJECT MANAGEMENT;GT BRAY PARK PUBLIC EDUCATION AND OUTREACH; AND SARASOTA BAY ARTIFICIAL REEFS MANAGEMENT.OUTCOMES:RESULTS/OUTCOMES: THE ARTIFICIAL REEFS WOULD BE USED TO SUPPLEMENT EXISTING REEF COMPLEXES, THEREFORE PERMITTING IS EXPECTED TO BE MINIMAL, REQUIRING ONLY THE RE-OPENING OF RECENTLY EXPIRED PERMITS.  THE REEF DESIGNS - CALLED 'DEEP COVERS' - ARE BASED ON UPGRADES TO PREVIOUSLY USED MOLDS FOR CAST CONCRETE.  CONTRACTORS THAT HAVE PREVIOUSLY ASSISTED SBEP IN PRIOR REEF MODULE PRODUCTION AND DEPLOYMENT ARE AVAILABLE FOR ADDITIONAL EFFORTS.  PENDING THE AVAILABILITY OF FUNDS, THE ARTIFICIAL REEFS SHOULD BE CONSTRUCTED AND DEPLOYED BY THE SUMMER OF 2023.  MONITORING THE USE AND USEFULNESS OF THESE DEPLOYED REEFS WOULD CARRY ON FOR ANYWHERE BETWEEN ONE TO THREE YEARS, DEPENDING ON THE VALUE OF ADDITIONAL DATA THAT WOULD BE GATHERED. THE CITIZENS OF FLORIDA WILL BE THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES.
