DESCRIPTION:THIS ACTION APPROVES FUNDING IN THE AMOUNT OF $750,000 FOR THE SARASOTA BAY TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES WITHIN THE SARASOTA BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM.ACTIVITIES:SARASOTA BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (SBEP) WILL CONTINUE EFFORTS TO COORDINATE EFFORTS AMONG OUR STAKEHOLDERS TO DEVELOP A LOCALLY LED, SCIENTIFICALLY SOUND WATER QUALITY AND ECOSYSTEM RESTORATION PROGRAM FOR THE BAY.  AS HAS BEEN VETTED THROUGH THE SBEP'S CITIZEN ADVISORY COMMITTEE, TECHNICAL ADVISORY COMMITTEE, MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE AND POLICY BOARDS, THE SBEP'S WATER QUALITY CONSORTIUM MEMBERS WILL PIVOT TOWARDS THE REVIEW OF ONGOING EFFORTS TO DEVELOP A REASONABLE ASSURANCE PLAN (RAP) FOR SARASOTA BAY.  A RAP IS A LOCALLY LED ALTERNATIVE TO A STATE OR FEDERAL TOTAL MAXIMUM DAILY LOAD (TMDL).  WHILE A RAP HAS THE SAME GOALS AS MORE TRADITIONAL TMDLS, RAPS ARE DONE IN A MORE COLLABORATIVE EFFORT, WITH MORE LOCAL BUY-IN OF POLLUTANT LOADING MODELS, WATER QUALITY TARGETS, AND LOAD REDUCTION ALLOCATIONS.  SUBRECIPIENT:NO SUBAWARDS ARE INCLUDED IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT.OUTCOMES:RESULTS/OUTCOMES: BAY PARTNERS GRANTS INVOLVE NOT ONLY OUTREACH AND EDUCATION, BUT THEY ALSO INCLUDE PROJECTS THAT IMPROVE THE PERFORMANCE OF STORMWATER TREATMENT SYSTEMS, REMOVE EXOTIC INVASIVE SPECIES, AND REMOVE DEBRIS FROM INTERTIDAL AND SUBMERGED RESOURCES. CCMP ACTION PLANS: MULTIPLE, CONSISTENT WITH THE COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT ACTION PLAN. CITIZENS WITH THE STATE OF FLORIDA AND ESTUARY DIRECTLY BENEFIT FROM THIS PROJECT.

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) THROUGH THE MASSACHUSETTS BAYS NATIONAL ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (MBP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ADDRESS THE KEY CHALLENGES FACING MASSBAYS WITH PARTICULAR EMPHASIS ON IMPAIRED WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT, CLIMATE VULNERABILITY, AND IMPACTS ON EJ COMMUNITIES. WORK UNDER THE AGREEMENT WILL FOCUS ON: 
- ACCELERATING AND MORE EXTENSIVELY IMPLEMENTING THE CCMP BY PROVIDING AN OPPORTUNITY TO EXECUTE LONG-TERM PROJECTS WITHIN MBP COMMUNITIES, LEVERAGE ADDITIONAL RESOURCES FOR SIGNIFICANT PROJECTS, AND WORK WITH KEY STAKEHOLDERS TO ADVANCE A WIDE RANGE OF PROJECTS IDENTIFIED IN THE NEWLY REVISED CCMP; 
- ENSURING THAT BENEFITS OF FEDERAL INVESTMENTS FROM ESTUARY PROGRAM PROJECTS ARE SHARED EQUITABLY AMONG COMMUNITIES BY PRIORITIZING PROJECTS THAT FLOW TO HISTORICALLY DISADVANTAGED COMMUNITIES;
- BUILDING THE ADAPTIVE CAPACITY OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES TO WITHSTAND CLIMATE CHANGE IMPACTS BY WORKING WITH FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL PARTNERS, OFTEN USING GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE AND NATURE-BASED SOLUTIONS AND ESPECIALLY THOSE THAT PROTECT AND RESTORE KEY HABITATS THAT INCREASE RESILIENCY AND CARBON SEQUESTRATION. IN IDENTIFYING PRIORITY ACTIONS, MASSBAYS WILL SELECT PROJECTS THAT ADVANCE THE CLIMATE RESILIENCE OF ECOSYSTEMS AND COMMUNITIES AND DELIVER CLIMATE EMISSIONS MITIGATION CO-BENEFITS; AND 
- LEVERAGING ADDITIONAL RESOURCES THROUGH COLLABORATION WITH OTHER FEDERAL AGENCIES AND NEW PARTNERS. ACTIVITIES:UNDER THIS WORKPLAN KEY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE, BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:
- MANAGING THE HEALTHY ESTUARIES SMALL GRANT PROGRAM TO MAKE AWARDS TO LOCAL PARTNERS ENGAGED IN MONITORING AND PLANNING FOR INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS
- ADVANCING STORMWATER MANAGEMENT TO IMPROVE WATER QUALITY AND ADDRESS FLOODING IN THE CITY OF MALDEN
- DEVELOPING SOLUTIONS TO FLOODING AND WATER QUALITY IMPAIRMENTS IN MERRIMACK RIVER TRIBUTARIES
- SUPPORTING MUNICIPAL AND REGIONAL ACTIONS THAT PROMOTE CLIMATE RESILIENT COASTAL HABITATS AND COMMUNITIES, 

SPECIFICALLY:
- THE MERRIMACK RIVER WATERSHED COUNCIL AND MYSTIC RIVER WATERSHED ASSOCIATION WILL LEAD LOCAL PROJECTS IN THEIR REGIONS THAT DIRECTLY ADDRESS SITUATIONS IN WHICH LACK OF LOCAL CAPACITY HAS HINDERED PROGRESS ON WATER MANAGEMENT.
- MASSBAYS' REGIONAL SERVICE PROVIDERS WILL ALSO INVEST BIL FUNDS INTO PROGRAMMING AND STAFFING THAT WILL BUILD LOCAL CAPACITY TO UNDERTAKE INFRASTRUCTURE IMPROVEMENTS.
- MASSBAYS' CENTRAL STAFF WILL INITIATE IMPLEMENTATION OF REGION-WIDE PLAN FOR LONGER-TERM CONTINUOUS MONITORING, PROVIDE DIRECT SUPPORT TO EJ COMMUNITIES SEEKING ASSISTANCE WITH COMMUNITY-INITIATED WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT MONITORING, AND DEVELOP A FIVE-YEAR PLAN FOR BIL FUNDING IMPLEMENTATION ALIGNED WITH CCMP GOALS, ESPECIALLY WITH REGARD TO EMPOWERING EJ AND OTHER UNDERSERVED COMMUNITIES TO BRING THEIR VOICES TO DECISION MAKING AT MULTIPLE LEVELS AND IN A VARIETY OF SETTINGS.SUBRECIPIENT:HIGHLIGHTED ACTIVITIES THROUGH SUBAWARDS INCLUDE: 
- SELECTION AND FUNDING OF NEW LOCAL PROJECTS THAT WILL CONTRIBUTE TO MEETING CCMP GOALS
- UPDATED STORMWATER ORDINANCE TO MS4 PERMIT STANDARDS VIA GAP ANALYSIS TO IDENTIFY CURRENT STATE OF MALDEN STORMWATER MANAGEMENT AND FUTURE FUNDING NEEDS; TECHNICAL ANALYSIS ON POTENTIAL ROLE OF A STORMWATER UTILITY;  ANALYSIS OF OPPORTUNITIES TO SITE GREEN INFRASTRUCTURE; AND INSTALLATION OF TEN INFILTRATION TRENCHES IN STRATEGIC LOCATIONS ALONG THE MALDEN RIVER.

- FOCUS ON THE SPICKET AND SHAWSHEEN RIVERS/WATERSHEDS TO ENGAGE KEY STAKEHOLDERS AND PARTNER AGENCIES; SAMPLING AND ANALYSIS ON THE SPICKET AND SHAWSHEEN RIVERS TO INFORM AMENDED MERRIMACK RIVER WQ MONITORING QUALITY ASSURANCE PROJECT PLAN (QAPP); SITE-SPECIFIC WATERSHED-BASED PLANS CONSISTENT WITH EPA 319 GUIDANCE; CONCEPTUA

DESCRIPTION: THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP (PREP), A NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) WITH A COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP).

THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD IS TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, NAMELY: RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF PREP AND ITS PARTNERS. 

THIS IS A NEW COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE TO SUPPORT THE NATIONAL ESTUARY, PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP, UNDER CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 320.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE (UNH) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP (PREP) NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF PREP AND ITS PARTNERS. THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT CONTINUE TO ENGAGE NEW HAMPSHIRE AND MAINE IN THE EFFORT; SYNTHESIZE, ANALYZE, AND INTERPRET ESTUARY ECOSYSTEM DATA; COMMUNICATE TIMELY, MEANINGFUL INFORMATION ON THE CONDITION OF THE BAY AND ITS ASSOCIATED WATERSHEDS, INCLUDING HABITATS, WATER QUALITY, AND INSTITUTIONAL EFFORTS; SERVE AS A REGIONAL LEADER FOR ESTABLISHING A WATERSHED-BASED FRAMEWORK THAT REFLECTS KEY MANAGEMENT ISSUES THAT CAN BE ADDRESSED AND ACTED ON IN BOTH NEW HAMPSHIRE AND MAINE, CONDUCT KEY RESTORATION AND PROTECTION ACTIVITIES THAT SECURE BROAD PUBLIC AND STAKEHOLDER SUPPORT; SERVE AS A CLEARINGHOUSE FOR INFORMATION ABOUT THE ESTUARIES; ACT AS A CONVENER WHEN NECESSARY TO CONVEY INFORMATION TO AND FROM THE PUBLIC, STATE AND FEDERAL AGENCIES, AND MUNICIPALITIES AND OTHER LOCAL GOVERNMENTS;  AND ADMINISTER THE PREP FOR EFFICIENT, RESPONSIVE AND ACCOUNTABLE PROGRAM AND COMMITTEE MANAGEMENT.

WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY UNH FACULTY AND STAFF, INCLUDING PREP STAFF AND UNH FACULTY IN OTHER DEPARTMENTS. THE GRANTEE, UNH, WILL REQUISITION AND ACQUIRE SOME SERVICES TO CONDUCT THE WORK BY ISSUING CONTRACTS TO SERVICE PROVIDERS. SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED IN PART TO PERFORM SOME OF THE WORK. FOR EXAMPLE, A SUBAWARD WILL BE MADE TO THE SOUTHEAST LAND TRUST FOR LAND CONSERVATION ACTIVITIES TO PROTECT THE WATERSHED AND REDUCE THE FUTURE POTENTIAL OF NUTRIENT AND OTHER POLLUTION LOADINGS TO THE ESTUARIES. 

 MORE DETAIL ABOUT THE SUBAWARDEES AND SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE PROVIDED BELOW IN SECTION A.23.D.

A KEY EXCERPT FROM THE WORKPLAN:

PREP: A REMINDER OF OUR PURPOSE AND HOW WE DO OUR WORK

LIKE THE OTHER 27 NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM SITES, PREP IS A NON#8208;REGULATORY ORGANIZATION CREATED 'TO IMPROVE THE
WATERS, HABITATS, AND LIVING RESOURCES' (NEP WEBSITE) OF THE GREAT BAY ESTUARY AND THE HAMPTON#8208;SEABROOK ESTUARY,
TWO ESTUARIES OF NATIONAL SIGNIFICANCE.

TO ACHIEVE ITS MISSION, PREP'S SMALL STAFF FOCUSES ON USING SCIENCE AND CONSENSUS#8208;BASED DECISION MAKING TO DESCRIBE
1) THE STATE OF OUR ESTUARIES (SOOE REPORTS), 2) THE STATE OF OUR MANAGEMENT (PREPA REPORT) AND RESTORATION
PRACTICES (HABITAT REPORTS), AND 3) A CLEAR PLAN FOR CONTINUALLY IMPROVING THE HEALTH OF THESE ESTUARIES (THE
COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN).
A HELPFUL MEDICAL ANALOGY...PREP'S JOB IS TO PROVIDE THE PATIENT DIAGNOSIS AND PATIENT TREATMENT (PREVENTION
AND RESTORATION) PLAN FOR OUR ESTUARIES.

LIKE ALL ORGANIZATIONS, PREP MUST THINK HARD ABOUT WHAT ACTIVITIES TO FOCUS ON. OUR GUIDING PRINCIPLE IS THIS: PREP
MUST BE AT THE TABLE FOR ALL ACTIVITIES THAT ACT AT THE SCALE OF THE WATERSHED OR THE ESTUARY. MOREOVER, IF NO ONE ELSE IS
LEADING AN INITIATIVE AT THE SCALE OF THE WATERSHED OR ESTUARY, PREP WILL ENDEAVOR TO DO SO.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO ROGER WILLIAMS UNIVERSITY (RWU) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NARRAGANSETT BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP), DEVELOPED BY A PARTNERSHIP OF FEDERAL, STATE, AND LOCAL REPRESENTATIVES OF THE PUBLIC. THE GOAL OF THIS AWARD AND THE NARRAGANSETT BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (NBEP) IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS AND ITS PARTNERS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES TO DRAFT NEW GOVERNANCE DOCUMENTS THAT REFLECT THE ROLES AND VALUE OF THE PROGRAM'S VARIOUS COMMITTEES AND PARTNERS, DEVELOP AT LEAST TWO PROPOSALS FOR PRIVATE OR PUBLIC FUNDING, PERIODICALLY PUBLISH SCIENCE UPDATES, CONTINUE WORK ON VISION 2032, CONVENE THE BLACKSTONE COLLABORATIVE CORE TEAM, DEVELOP AND RELEASE REQUESTS FOR PROPOSALS (RFPS), MANAGE SUBAWARDS, AND HOST A SCIENCE CONFERENCE/WORKSHOP.

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP (PREP), A NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) WITH A COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE PURPOSE OF THE AWARD, AWARDED UNDER CLEAN WATER ACT (CWA) SECTION 320 AND FUNDED VIA THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL)/ INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) IS TO IMPLEMENT THE CCMP, NAMELY: RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN THE BIL ITERATION-ONE WORKPLAN OF PREP AND ITS PARTNERS. THIS IS A NEW COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE TO SUPPORT THIS NATIONALLY DESIGNATED ESTUARY UNDER CWA 320, THE PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP, UNDER CLEAN WATER ACT SECTION 320 AND THE INFRASTRUCTURE INVESTMENT AND JOBS ACT (IIJA) (PL 117-58). THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF NEW HAMPSHIRE (UNH) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP (PREP) NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (NEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES.

IN PARTICULAR, THIS BIL/IIJA ITERATION-ONE AWARD WILL IMPLEMENT INFRASTRUCTURAL WORK TO RESTORE, PRESERVE, AND ENHANCE THE ECOLOGICAL, WATER QUALITY, HUMAN AND WILDLIFE HABITAT FUNCTIONS OF THE WATERS IN THE REGION AND WATERSHED, AND ARE FURTHER DETAILED IN A.23.B BELOW.

WORK WILL BE PERFORMED BY UNH FACULTY AND STAFF, INCLUDING PREP STAFF AND UNH FACULTY IN OTHER DEPARTMENTS. THE GRANTEE, UNH, WILL REQUISITION AND ACQUIRE SOME SERVICES TO CONDUCT THE WORK BY ISSUING CONTRACTS TO SERVICE PROVIDERS. SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED IN PART TO PERFORM SOME OF THE WORK. FOR EXAMPLE, A COMPETITIVE GRANT PROGRAM (PREPA) TO LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES. MORE DETAIL ABOUT THE SUBAWARDEES AND SUBRECIPIENT ACTIVITIES ARE PROVIDED BELOW IN SECTION A.23.D, AS WELL AS IN THE BIL ITERATION-ONE WORKPLAN.

ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES THAT SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE PREP CCMP ARE DESCRIBED IN THE BIL COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT ANNUAL WORKPLAN AND CONTINUE TO ENGAGE THE STATE AND LOCAL AGENCIES AND RESIDENTS OF NEW HAMPSHIRE, MAINE, AND A FEW SQUARE MILES OF MASSACHUSETTS IN THE EFFORT. IN SHORT, THOSE INCLUDE BUT ARE NOT LIMITED TO:

* COMMUNICATIONS AND COORDINATION AMONG PARTNERS AND STAKEHOLDERS
* ENHANCEMENT OF DIVERSITY, EQUITY, JUSTICE, AND INCLUSION ACTIVITIES
* ENHANCED SEAGRASS AND SEAWEED MONITORING
* PURCHASE OF NEW WATER QUALITY DATASONDE AND PROBE
* DEVELOPMENT OF A LOCALIZED INDEX OF BIOTIC INTEGRITY
* PREPA IMPLEMENTATION GRANTS
* LAND CONSERVATION INITIATIVES
* SAM PLUMMER ROAD CULVERT REPLACEMENT
* EXPANDED MUSSELWATCH MONITORING FOCUSING ON TOXIC CONTAMINANTS
SUBRECIPIENT:SUBAWARDS WILL BE MADE TO LOCAL MUNICIPALITIES VIA A COMPETITIVE GRANT PROCESS, THE CEP PROGRAM OF PREP. PISCATAQUA REGION ESTUARIES PARTNERSHIP'S (PREP) COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PROGRAM (CEP) IS DESCRIBED BELOW.

THE PREP CEP WILL BE A RESOURCE TO SUPPORT AND EMPOWER COMMUNITIES IN THE PISCATAQUA REGION WATERSHED TO STRENGTHEN AND ENFORCE LOCAL REGULATIONS AND PROMOTE THE PROTECTION AND STEWARDSHIP OF OUR SHARED RESOURCES FOR IMPROVED WATER QUALITY, ECOLOGICAL HEALTH, COASTAL ADAPTATION, AND CLIMATE RESILIENCE.
CEP PRIORITIES FOR 2023:
- UPDATE THE PISCATAQUA REGION ENVIRONMENTAL PLANNING ASSESSMENT  (PREPA) (2023) AND COMPLETE GRANTS PROGRAM TO ASSIST COMMUNITIES IN ADOPTING PREPA RECOMMENDATIONS.OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE:

* DATA ON TIER 3 SEAGRASS/SEAWEED MONITORING AT TWO SITES IN THE GREAT BAY ESTUARY
* PURCHASE OF NEW DATASONDES AND PROBES FOR ESTUARINE WATER QUALITY MONITORING
* ACQUISITION OF A SENSOR PACKAGE FOR MONITORING THE WISWALL DAM ON THE LAMPREY RIVER.
* ACQUISITION OF  AIRBORNE IMAGERY FOR SALT MARSH

DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MAINE THROUGH THE UNIVERSITY OF MAINE SYSTEM TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW
(BIL) THROUGH THE CASCO BAY ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (CBEP) CASCO BAY PLAN, I.E., THEIR COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN THIS BIPARTISAN INFRASTRUCTURE LAW (BIL) WORKPLAN OF THE CBEP AND ITS PARTNERS. CBEP HAS DESIGNED EIGHT PROGRAMS THAT PROVIDE STRUCTURE FOR THE FIVE-TO-SEVEN-YEAR SPENDING PLAN FOR BIL FUNDING. THE EIGHT PROGRAMS ADDRESS LONG-STANDING AND EMERGING NEEDS FOR MANAGEMENT OF CASCO BAY AS IDENTIFIED BY CBEP, WITH THE ADVICE OF PARTNERS AND MEMBERS OF THE MANAGEMENT COMMITTEE. THESE PROGRAMS SUPPORT HABITAT RESTORATION, RESILIENCE AND CONSERVATION; ENHANCE MONITORING AND SCIENCE TO GUIDE FUTURE MANAGEMENT; AND ASSIST COMMUNITIES ADDRESSING CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND WATER NEEDS.ACTIVITIES:YEAR 1 ACTIVITIES INCLUDE EXPANDING THE LONG-RUNNING HABITAT PROTECTION FUND; FACILITATION OF LAND CONSERVATION PARTNERSHIPS AND COALITIONS THROUGH ADDITIONAL STAFF HIRES; SUPPORTING EFFORTS BY LOCAL GOVERNMENTS TO ADDRESS RESILIENCE, WATER QUALITY, AND HABITAT ISSUES; DEVELOPMENT OF A MONITORING INFRASTRUCTURE GRANTS PROGRAM WILL OFFER GRANTS TO COVER A PORTION OF 
THE COSTS OF EXPANDED MONITORING CAPACITY IN THE REGION; AND THE DEVELOPMENT OF A MODERN HYDRODYNAMIC MODEL OF CASCO BAY THAT IS DESIGNED TO ADDRESSES MULTIPLE REGULATORY, SCIENTIFIC, CLIMATE RESILIENCE AND MUNICIPAL INTERESTS AND NEEDS.SUBRECIPIENT:CBEP WILL PARTNER WITH THE NORTHEAST REGIONAL ASSOCIATION OF COASTAL OCEAN OBSERVING SYSTEMS (NERACOOS) AND UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS, DARTMOUTH TO DEVELOP A HIGH-RESOLUTION SUBMODEL OF THE NORTHEAST COASTAL OCEAN FORECASTING SYSTEM THAT WILL COVER CASCO BAY. THE MODEL WILL ADDRESS 'WETTING AND DRYING' OF INTERTIDAL ZONES TO MODEL WATER MOVEMENT IN THE EASTERN AND NORTHERN BAY, WHERE EXTENSIVE TIDAL FLATS HAVE A STRONG IMPACT ON WATER MOVEMENT. THE DATA WILL ALSO INCORPORATE DATA ON TOPOGRAPHY OF THE SHORE TO ASSESS FLOODING AND CLIMATE CHANGE RISKS. CBEP WILL PROVIDE $186,826 AS A SUBAWARD TO NERACOOS. OUTCOMES:ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES/OUTCOMES INCLUDE: FUNDING SUPPORT FOR THREE TO FIVE HABITAT PROTECTION PROJECTS; CREATION OF A NEW CASCO BAY ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (CBEP) RESTORATION/RESILIENCE WORKING GROUP; FUND DEVELOPMENT OF A HIGH-RESOLUTION CASCO BAY HYDRODYNAMIC MODEL BY THE NORTHEAST REGIONAL ASSOCIATION OF COASTAL OCEAN OBSERVING SYSTEMS AND UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS DARTMOUTH; INCREASED ENGAGEMENT WITH SMALLER TOWNS IN THE CASCO BAY WATERSHED, ESPECIALLY COMMUNITIES IN MIDDLE AND UPPER WATERSHED WITH WHOM CBEP HAS NOT ALREADY DEVELOPED STRONG WORKING TIES; INCREASED MONITORING CAPABILITIES IN THE CASCO BAY REGION

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE RESIDENTS OF THE CASCO BAY WATERSHED STUDY AREA IN MAINE AND THE ECOSYSTEMS AND USERS OF ECOSYSTEM SERVICES.

THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT  IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MASSACHUSETTS BAYS NATIONAL ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (MBP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). 

THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF THE MBP AND ITS PARTNERS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ADDRESS THE KEY CHALLENGES FACING MASSBAYS: ALTERED HYDROLOGYAND IMPAIRED WATER QUALITY AND HABITATAND CLIMATE VULNERABILITYAND INVASIVE SPECIESAND ECOSYSTEM FRAGMENTATIONAND AND IMPACTS ON EJ COMMUNITIES.  ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SETTING AND APPLYING RESTORATION TARGETS TO GUIDE ACTIONS IN THE FIVE MASSBAYS REGIONS, DISSEMINATING AND ENCOURAGING USE OF THE AQUAQAPP APPLICATION BY WATERSHED AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONSAND LAUNCHING AND IMPLEMENTING THE REVISED CCMP, INCLUDING UPDATED MONITORING, COMMUNICATION, AND EJ STRATEGIESAND DEVELOPING A STATE OF THE BAYS REPORT FOR PUBLIC AND SCIENTIFIC AUDIENCESAND FUNDING RESEARCH TO FILL PRIORITY DATA GAPS THROUGH COMPETITIVE GRANTSAND AND INCORPORATING EJ INTO MANAGEMENT DELIBERATIONS. 

DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: RESIDENTS OF THE 50 COMMUNITIES ALONG THE MASSACHUSETTS SHORELINE IN FIVE LOCAL MANAGEMENT REGIONSAND THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE MBP WATERSHED AND STUDY AREAAND OTHER NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAMS AND COASTAL MANAGEMENT PROGRAMSAND AND MASSACHUSETTS COASTAL ECOSYSTEMS. 

SUBAWARDS WILL BE DEVELOPED TO IMPLEMENT PRIORITY ACTION PLANS IN THE CCMP AND ADDRESS DATA NEEDS AND GAPS.

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO MASSACHUSETTS EXECUTIVE OFFICE OF ENERGY AND ENVIRONMENTAL AFFAIRS (MA EOEEA) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MASSACHUSETTS BAYS NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (MBNEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF THE MBNEP AND ITS PARTNERS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT WILL REMEDIATE AND RESTORE WETLANDS, LESSEN POLLUTION FROM STORMWATER AND WASTEWATER, AND HELP COMMUNITIES WITH OPEN SPACE AND NATURAL RESOURCE PLANNING AND PROTECTION

DESCRIPTION:THE PURPOSE OF THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE MASSACHUSETTS BAYS NATIONAL ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP (MBP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF THE MBP AND ITS PARTNERS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT WILL ADDRESS THE KEY CHALLENGES FACING MASSBAYS: ALTERED HYDROLOGY; IMPAIRED WATER QUALITY AND HABITAT; CLIMATE VULNERABILITY; INVASIVE SPECIES; ECOSYSTEM FRAGMENTATION; AND IMPACTS ON EJ COMMUNITIES. ANTICIPATED DELIVERABLES INCLUDE APPLYING RESTORATION TARGETS TO GUIDE ACTIONS IN THE FIVE MASSBAYS REGIONS, IMPROVING THE AQUAQAPP APPLICATION AND EXPANDING ITS USE BY WATERSHED AND OTHER ORGANIZATIONS; LAUNCHING AND IMPLEMENTING THE REVISED CCMP, INCLUDING UPDATED MONITORING, COMMUNICATION, AND EJ STRATEGIES; ISSUING A STATE OF THE BAYS REPORT FOR PUBLIC AND SCIENTIFIC AUDIENCES; FUNDING RESEARCH TO FILL PRIORITY DATA GAPS THROUGH COMPETITIVE GRANTS; AND INCORPORATING EJ INTO MANAGEMENT DELIBERATIONS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE: RESIDENTS OF THE 50 COMMUNITIES ALONG THE MASSACHUSETTS SHORELINE IN FIVE LOCAL MANAGEMENT REGIONS; THE GENERAL PUBLIC IN THE MBP WATERSHED AND STUDY AREA; OTHER NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAMS AND COASTAL MANAGEMENT PROGRAMS; AND MASSACHUSETTS COASTAL ECOSYSTEMS. SUBAWARDS WILL BE DEVELOPED TO IMPLEMENT PRIORITY ACTION PLANS IN THE CCMP AND ADDRESS DATA NEEDS AND GAPS.ACTIVITIES:KEY ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 
- FINALIZING AND SUBMITTING THE REVISED MASSBAYS' CCMP, INCLUDING DEVELOPING UPDATED FINANCE PLAN AND MONITORING STRATEGY; A STATE OF THE BAYS CONFERENCE WILL BE ASSOCIATED WITH THE RELEASE OF THE FINAL CCMP
- ESTABLISHING A NEW CENTER AT UNIVERSITY OF MASSACHUSETTS BOSTON (UMB) WITHIN ITS SCHOOL FOR THE ENVIRONMENT (SFE)
- FINAL REPORTING ON A PROJECT TO INCREASE CONFIDENCE IN EELGRASS MAPS USED FOR PROJECT REVIEW AND OCEAN PLANNING.  
- INVESTIGATING AQUACULTURE-EELGRASS INTERACTIONS TO INFORM POLICY.  
- LAUNCHING MASSWATER, AN EXTENSION OF THE AQUAQAPP APPLICATION THAT WILL ENABLE .MONITORING PARTNERS TO CARRY OUT QA/QC DATA ANALYSIS ACCORDING TO DEP AND EPA STANDARDS.
- EXPANDING SUPPORT TO UNDERSERVED AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING OFFERING DIRECT ASSISTANCE AND CAPACITY-BUILDING TO FACILITATE COMMUNITY INPUT INTO DECISION MAKING.
- MONITORING AND RESTORING BLUE MUSSELS AND MONITORING FOR SEA BROOK TROUT
- INCORPORATING SOCIOECONOMIC VARIABLES INTO RESTORATION PLANNING TO BETTER INFORM PRIORITIES FOR RESTORATION EFFORTS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREAS.
- REVIEWING BYLAWS FOR CLIMATE RESILIENCY.  SUBRECIPIENT:MBP WILL WORK WITH THE REGIONAL SERVICE PROVIDERS (RSPS) IN THE FIVE MBP GEOGRAPHIC REGIONS AND THE MYSTIC RIVER WATERSHED ASSOCIATION TO PRIORITIZE, ACTIVATE, AND IMPLEMENT PROJECTS  TO ACHIEVE CCMP GOALS; AND TO DEVELOP INFORMATION TO MONITOR AND TRACK MBP PROGRESS TOWARDS CCMP GOALS. HIGHLIGHTED ACTIVITIES INCLUDE: 
- FINAL REPORTING ON A PROJECT TO INCREASE CONFIDENCE IN EELGRASS MAPS USED FOR PROJECT REVIEW AND OCEAN PLANNING.  
- INVESTIGATING AQUACULTURE-EELGRASS INTERACTIONS TO INFORM POLICY.  
- LAUNCHING MASSWATER, AN EXTENSION OF THE AQUAQAPP APPLICATION THAT WILL ENABLE .MONITORING PARTNERS TO CARRY OUT QA/QC DATA ANALYSIS ACCORDING TO DEP AND EPA STANDARDS.
- EXPANDING SUPPORT TO UNDERSERVED AND ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE COMMUNITIES, INCLUDING OFFERING DIRECT ASSISTANCE AND CAPACITY-BUILDING TO FACILITATE COMMUNITY INPUT INTO DECISION MAKING.
- MONITORING AND RESTORING BLUE MUSSELS AND MONITORING FOR SEA BROOK TROUT
- INCORPORATING SOCIOECONOMIC VARIABLES INTO RESTORATION PLANNING TO BETTER INFORM PRIORITIES FOR RESTORATION EFFORTS IN ENVIRONMENTAL JUSTICE AREAS.
- REVIEWING BYLAWS FOR CLIMATE RESILIENCY

THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO NEW ENGLAND INTERSTATE POLLUTION CONTROL COMMISSION (NEIWPCC) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE NARRAGANSETT BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THIS AWARD WILL SUPPORT TASKS OUTLINED IN A SOUTHEAST NEW ENGLAND PROGRAM FUNDED WORKPLAN WHEREBY NBEP WILL RELEASE A REQUEST FOR PROPOSALS TO SUPPORT APPLIED RESEARCH, PLANNING, AND IMPLEMENTATION PROJECTS IN THE NARRAGANSETT BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM STUDY AREA. DESCRIPTION:THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE UNIVERSITY OF SOUTHERN MAINE, WHICH IS PART OF THE UNIVERSITY OF MAINE SYSTEM, TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CASCO BAY ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP'S (CBEP) COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP). THE GOAL IS TO RESTORE AND MAINTAIN THE CHEMICAL, PHYSICAL, AND BIOLOGICAL INTEGRITY OF THE ESTUARY AND SUPPORT ITS SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES THROUGH TASKS OUTLINED IN ANNUAL WORKPLANS OF THE CBEP AND ITS PARTNERS. THE COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT SUPPORTS ACTIVITIES THAT WILL: 1) PROTECT, RESTORE, AND ENHANCE KEY HABITATS THAT SUSTAIN ECOLOGICAL HEALTH; 2) REDUCE NUTRIENT POLLUTION AND ITS IMPACTS, INCLUDING COASTAL ACIDIFICATION; 3) FOSTER RESILIENT COMMUNITIES AND THEIR CONNECTIONS TO CASCO BAY, AND; 4) MOBILIZE COLLECTIVE KNOWLEDGE AND RESOURCES TO SUPPORT CASCO BAY. SUBAWARDS WILL BE USED TO SUPPORT THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT. THIS IS IMPLEMENTATION YEAR 27.ACTIVITIES:INCREASE DEVELOPMENT OF HABITAT RESTORATION AND RESILIENCE PROJECTS AND ASSIST PARTNERS WITH ACCESSING ARPA AND BIL FUNDS FOR PROJECT IMPLEMENTATION; STRENGTHEN TIES WITH SMALLER MUNICIPALITIES TO ASSIST THEM WITH ADDRESSING WATER QUALITY AND CLIMATE RESILIENCE CHALLENGES AND ACCESSING ARPA AND BIL FUNDS; BEGIN IMPLEMENTATION OF PROGRAMS AND PROJECTS MADE POSSIBLE BY BIL FUNDS; AND UPDATE THE CASCO BAY PLAN (CCMP)SUBRECIPIENT:WATER QUALITY MONITORING OUTCOMES:PRIMARY DELIVERABLE WILL BE AN UPDATED CCMP. OTHER EXPECTED OUTCOMES INCLUDE HABITAT PROTECTED AND RESTORED, WATER QUALITY IMPROVEMENTS, INCREASED PUBLIC ACCESS TO NATURAL AREAS, DATA ACQUISITION, AND PROVISION OF TECHNICAL ASSISTANCE TO MUNICIPALITIES AND OTHER PARTNERS. THE INTENDED BENEFICIARIES OF THIS WORK INCLUDE THE CONSTITUENTS WHO RESIDE WITHIN THE CASCO BAY ESTUARY PARTNERSHIP PLANNING AREA, AS WELL AS ALL OTHERS WHO RECREATE THERE.

DESCRIPTION:A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE LOUISIANA UNIVERSITIES MARINE CONSORTIUM (LUMCON) AND BARATARIA TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (BTNEP) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE BARATARIA TERREBONNE ESTUARY. ACTIVITIES:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, COORDINATING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) BY BARATARIA TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (BTNEP,) AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND LOCAL AGENCIES; AND MONITORING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED UNDER THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP), IN ADDITION TO, WATER QUALITY MONITORING, DEVELOPING EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, CONDUCTING EDUCATIONAL WORKSHOPS, STUDYING THE TEMPERATURE SENSITIVITY OF THE APPLE SNAIL AND SWALLOW-TAIL KITES AND STUDYING OF INFLUENCES ON THE CRAYFISH POPULATION. SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES FOR SUBAWARDS IN THIS ASSISTANCE AGREEMENT INCLUDE CONDUCTING WORKSHOPS, DEVELOPMENT AND PRODUCTION OF EDUCATIONAL MATERIALS, MONITORING, THE STUDY OF INFLUENCES ON THE CRAYFISH POPULATION, AND THE STUDY OF THE SWALLOW-TAIL KITES AND TEMPERATURE SENSITIVITY OF THE APPLE SNAIL.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, ALONG WITH PROJECT FINAL REPORTS WHICH INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, A SUMMARY REPORT DOCUMENTING THE IMPLEMENTATION OF THE RESOURCE MANAGEMENT AND PUBLIC EDUCATION ACTIVITIES. ADDITIONALLY, DELIVERING QUALITY CONTENT THAT IS RELEVANT TO THE MISSION OF BARATARIA TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (BTNEP) THROUGH SOCIAL AND TRADITIONAL MEDIA PLATFORMS. CREATING AND STRENGTHEN BARATARIA TERREBONNE NATIONAL ESTUARY PROGRAM (BTNEP)'S RELATIONSHIPS WITH SPECIFIC STAKEHOLDERS, ORGANIZATIONS AND BUSINESSES IN ITS TARGET MARKETS. ALSO, CREATE A KNOWLEDGEABLE CITIZENRY, EDUCATED IN THE NATURAL HISTORY OF THE REGION, TO ENHANCE THE ABILITY TO EXCHANGE INFORMATION (NETWORKING) WITHIN THE PROGRAM AND TO PROVIDE WORKSHOP ATTENDEES WITH THE OPPORTUNITY TO LEARN FROM EXPERTS IN A VARIETY OF NATURAL SCIENCE FIELDS. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES INCLUDE THE STATE OF LOUISIANA RESIDENTS.

DESCRIPTION:THESE FUNDS TO THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S (TCEQ) GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (GBEP) PROVIDE SUPPORT IN IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN.

 ACTIVITIES:ALL ACTIVITIES FOCUS ON MAINTAINING, RESTORING, AND/OR IMPROVING WATER QUALITY THROUGH A VARIETY OF METHODS INCLUDING, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LAND CONSERVATION, WATER QUALITY IMPLEMENTATION OUTREACH, GI PROJECTS, AND MICROPLASTICS AND EMERGING CONTAMINANTS RESEARCH.SUBRECIPIENT:ACTIVITIES INCLUDE IMPLEMENTATION OF AN APPROVED COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN FOR THE GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY, INCLUDING OUTREACH, EDUCATION AND MONITORING ACTIVITIES THAT WORK TOWARDS PROTECTING AND RESTORING THE UNIQUE ESTUARY ECOSYSTEM. SUBAWARDS FOR THIS COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, LOCAL UNIVERSITIES, LOCAL AREA-WIDE AGENCIES, CITY OF HOUSTON, AND HARRIS COUNTY.OUTCOMES:DELIVERABLES INCLUDE SEMI-ANNUAL REPORTS, ALONG WITH PROJECT FINAL REPORTS WHICH INCLUDE, BUT NOT LIMITED TO, AN ESTUARY RESILIENCY ASSESSMENT AND ACTION PLAN, TARGETED MONITORING REPORT, COMMUNITY ENGAGEMENT PLAN, AND WATER MANAGEMENT PLAN. SOME EXPECTED LONG-TERM OUTCOMES INCLUDE: THE PERMANENT CONSERVATION OF COASTAL HABITAT AND PRESERVATION OF IMPORTANT HYDROLOGIC/WATER QUALITY FUNCTIONS; SIGNIFICANT REDUCTION OF BACTERIA LEVELS TO ATTAIN WQ STANDARDS; PROVIDING FRAMEWORK FOR NATURE-BASED INFRASTRUCTURE GOALS; AND THE REDUCTION OF  POLLUTION/SEDIMENT LOADS VIA RUN-OFF. DIRECT BENEFICIARIES OF THIS PROGRAM INCLUDE GALVESTON BAY AREA, HUMAN HEALTH, THE ENVIRONMENT AND ALL STATE RESIDENTS AND OCCUPANTS, BOTH PERMANENT AND TEMPORARY.

A COOPERATIVE AGREEMENT IS PROVIDED TO THE TEXAS COMMISSION ON ENVIRONMENTAL QUALITY'S (TCEQ) GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY PROGRAM (GBEP) TO SUPPORT IMPLEMENTATION OF THE COMPREHENSIVE CONSERVATION AND MANAGEMENT PLAN (CCMP) AND ACCOMPANYING STRATEGIC PLAN TO IMPROVE THE WATER QUALITY, PROTECT THE NATURAL HABITAT AND LIVING RESOURCES, AND SUPPORT SUSTAINABLE HUMAN USES OF THE GALVESTON BAY ESTUARY. ACTIVITIES INCLUDE ASSESSING TRENDS IN WATER QUALITY, NATURAL RESOURCES AND USES; COORDINATING IMPLEMENTATION OF THE CCMP BY THE STATE, AS WELL AS FEDERAL AND LOCAL AGENCIES; AND MONITORING THE EFFECTIVENESS OF ACTIVITIES CONDUCTED UNDER THE CCMP.
